A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

Legiana is a slim, primarily beige-coloured Flying Wyvern characterised by its leaf-like wingtips and striped skin patterns. Legiana's head is topped with a pair of antenna-like fins which are attached via a thin membrane to the back of its neck. It has bright yellow eyes and powerful legs ending in piercing talons. Its face, tail, feet, and wingtips are a dark navy blue, and its body is covered in striped patterns of the same colour. The ends of its wings are separated into four distinct flaps which overlap each other when folded. Legiana has star-like shapes on the back of its wings. Its back is also dark blue.

Legiana is able to emit a chilling wind from its body, which dulls its prey's ability to escape. It flies with extreme precision and agility, using its talons to grab its prey straight out of the air. Its legs are strong enough to throw even medium-sized monsters such as {@creature Paolumu|MHMM} considerable distances once they are in its grasp.

items.name: Legiana Hide
entries: {@i Airborne.} Mentre si indossa questa armatura, si può lanciare l'incantesimo {@spell jump} da essa come azione bonus a volontà, ma si può bersagliare solo se stessi quando lo si fa.

items.name: Legiana Scale
entries: {@i (Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, & Wizard only)} While attuned to this armor you can cast the {@spell wall of ice} spell three times per day, without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Legiana Wing
entries: {@i Wind Resist.} You and your equipment suffer no ill effects from Strong Winds (DMG p.110) while you wear this armor.

items.name: Frost Sac
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da freddo quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Legiana Plate
entries: {@i Evade Window.} Questa armatura ha 3 rune e recupera 1d3 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Quando si fallisce un tiro salvezza di Destrezza mentre si indossa l'armatura, si può usare la reazione per spendere 1 runa per riuscire il tiro salvezza.

items.name: Legiana Gem
entries: {@i Good Luck.} While you are attuned to this armor, you have one luck point that you regain daily at dawn. You may use this point as if you had the Lucky feat.

items.name: Legiana Hide
entries: This weapon has a reservoir of ice magic that can freeze the ground for up to 1 minute. While holding this weapon, you can use an action to plant this weapon in the ground and release the ice magic within. While planted and undepleted, the ground in a 10-foot radius of this weapon becomes difficult terrain. This weapon recharges 3d6 seconds of energy to the weapon's reservoir daily at dawn.

items.name: Legiana Scale
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause thick, opaque poison to coat the blade of a melee weapon that deals slashing or piercing damage. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} cold damage and become poisoned with {@condition iceblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. This effect can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Legiana Claw
entries: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da freddo in più.

items.name: Legiana Wing
entries: {@i Critical Draw+.} Durante il primo round di combattimento, gli attacchi con armi da mischia ottengono un colpo critico con un tiro di 15 o superiore.

items.name: Frost Sac
entries: You gain a + 1 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC while attuned to this weapon. This bonus increases to +2 when the spell you are casting deals cold damage, such as the {@spell ice knife|XGE} or {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|XGE} spell.

items.name: Legiana Plate
entries: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da freddo in più.

trait.name: Aura of Crows
entries: At the start of each of the leshen's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. A creature that touches the leshen or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Crows
entries: The leshen has an infinite number of crows (using the {@creature Raven} stat block). Should any die, the leshen conjures more at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Fire Susceptibility
entries: If the leshen takes fire damage, it suffers several effects until the end of its next turn: it cannot teleport, it can't use its Multiattack, and it only regains 2 legendary actions at the start of its turn.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The leshen's weapon attacks are magical and its ranged weapon attacks ignore cover.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leshen uses its root strike and then makes two claw attack attacks. It can replace one of its claw attacks with its murder of crows attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw}  {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Root Strike
entries: The leshen targets a creature that it can see within 90 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity or Strength saving throw, or they are pushed back 10 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and they are not knocked {@condition prone}, but they are still pushed back 10 feet.

action.name: Murder of Crows
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the creature is {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, the crows continue to circle the target. While they circle, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage at the start of its turn. The crows stop circling once the creature is no longer {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Entangling Roots
entries: The ancient leshen chooses a creature on the ground that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by entangling roots. A creature {@condition restrained} by the roots can use its action to make a {@dc 18} Strength check, freeing itself on a success.

action.name: Gnarled Growth {@recharge 5}
entries: The leshen releases a pulse of energy through the ground causing gnarled roots to explode outward in a 20-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) piercing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a successful saving throw.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Il leshen effettua un attacco con gli artigli o con l'omicidio dei corvi.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Il corpo della lesena, insieme all'equipaggiamento che indossa o porta con sé, si disperde in alcune decine di corvi e poi si riforma fino a 60 piedi in uno spazio non occupato che riesce a vedere.

legendary.name: Imprison (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The leshen uses its Entangling Roots.

legendary.name: Summon Jagras (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The leshen calls 3 ({@dice 1d6}) {@creature jagras|MHMM} to its aid.

reaction.name: Conjure Roots {@recharge}
entries: When an enemy creature ends its turn, the leshen can use its reaction to create a wall of roots from the ground around it. The wall forms in a circle that has a 15-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area is pushed 5 feet away from the leshen. A creature cannot pass through the wall, but each 5 foot section of the wall can be attacked and destroyed. (AC 10; hp 30; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

La struttura corporea e la biologia di Leshen sono completamente estranee al mondo conosciuto. La creatura si regge su due arti che sostengono un corpo inquietantemente umanoide fatto di quello che sembra essere legno, che ricopre con abiti stracciati; dalle sue spalle spuntano rami che potrebbero avere appesi i resti delle sue vittime più recenti. La testa del Leshen è un teschio di animale, sormontato da un paio di corna diverse da quelle viste nel Vecchio e nel Nuovo Mondo. Il Leshen sembra essere privo di occhi, bocca o altre caratteristiche che ci si aspetta dalla testa di un mostro vivente. In effetti, nel suo mondo si pensa che sia uno spirito della natura piuttosto che una creatura vivente.

Le uniche caratteristiche del Leshen che potrebbero avere un senso sono le sue lunghe braccia, che terminano con artigli affilati come rasoi. Sebbene i Leshen non siano così veloci o feroci nei combattimenti ravvicinati come molte creature del mondo conosciuto, la sua mente astuta e la sua magia gli permettono di fare un uso efficace dei suoi artigli, spesso compiendo manovre ingannevolmente lente o usando il teletrasporto per colpire alle spalle avversari incauti.

Geralt di Rivia, il Witcher che proviene dallo stesso mondo dei Leshen, ha notato che la creatura si è resa più potente dei suoi fratelli medi nel loro mondo natale assorbendo le ricche sostanze nutritive del Nuovo Mondo.

I Leshen sono molto territoriali e attaccano tutto ciò che non possono (o non vogliono) influenzare con la loro magia. Si dice che siano in stretta sintonia con le foreste in cui vivono e che uccidano chiunque non le tratti con rispetto. Per questo motivo, le leggende del suo mondo natale affermano che i Leshen disprezzano gli umani che distruggono le foreste per espandere i loro insediamenti.

I Leshen possono evocare e controllare radici strangolanti dal terreno e prendere il controllo delle menti delle creature minori. Finora, {@creature Jagras|MHMM}, {@creature Gajalaka|MHMM} e Revolture sono le uniche creature che si sono dimostrate vulnerabili al controllo mentale di un Leshen. È stato anche osservato che si teletrasportano, dissolvendosi in una nuvola di fumo che si riforma altrove.

items.name: Leshen Claw
entries: {@i Marathon Runner+.} Quando si indossa questa armatura, la velocità di camminata aumenta di 3 metri e si ignorano i terreni difficili se non sono stati creati da un effetto magico.

items.name: Cursed Bone
entries: {@i Recovery Speed.} Ogni volta che si tira un dado ferita per recuperare punti ferita, si raddoppia il numero di punti ferita ripristinati.

items.name: Leshen Resin
entries: {@i Health Boost.} Quando si indossa questa armatura, i punti ferita massimi aumentano di 1 per ogni livello di personaggio posseduto.

items.name: Leshen Skull
entries: While wearing this armor, you can cast the {@spell misty step} spell from it as a bonus action. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn. The mist takes the form of a murder of crows.

items.name: Leshen Antlers
entries: {@i Super Recovery.} Whenever you would gain temporary hit points, you can instead increase your hit point maximum and current hit points by that amount for 24 hours. You can only increase your maximum hit points by 20 with this effect, any additional temporary hit points gained beyond that are lost. Once used, this property can't be used again for 24 hours.

items.name: Leshen Claw
entries: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da taglio in più.

items.name: Cursed Bone
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit.} Quando si ha vantaggio su un tiro di attacco con quest'arma e si colpisce il bersaglio, si può far infliggere alla propria arma il massimo dei danni se il più basso dei due tiri di d20 colpirebbe anche il bersaglio (tutti i dadi di danno extra devono essere comunque tirati). Si può usare questa proprietà un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Forza o Destrezza (a scelta), recuperando tutti gli utilizzi al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: Leshen Resin
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use an action to summon a {@creature shamos|MHMM} to your aid for 1 hour. it will act on your turn in the initiative and will flee if you or your allies attempt to harm it. One you use this property, you cannot use it again for 3 days.

items.name: Leshen Skull
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 1.

items.name: Leshen Antlers
entries: This weapon has 5 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast the {@spell burning hands} spell (save DC 14) from it. For 1 rune, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional rune you expend.
This weapon regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last runes, roll a d20. On a 1. The weapon can't regain any runes for 1 week.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Il ludroth può respirare aria e acqua.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the ludroth moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a Headbutt Attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not poisoned on a successful save. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, end the poison on a successful save.

Ludroth are mostly yellow-green in coloration, with long, sinewy bodies that enable swift and sweeping underwater movements to confuse their prey. Their claws are stubby, but effective, and their strong tails end in reinforced bony segments. Powerful jaws allow for moderately strong biting attacks. The majority of Ludroth are female, and form harems around the male {@creature Royal Ludroth|MHMM}.

items.name: Hydro Hide
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura, si ha una velocità di nuoto pari alla velocità di camminata.

items.name: Immature Sponge
entries: Si ha un vantaggio sui controlli per trovare un luogo di pesca e per catturare {@table fish|AGMH} quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Sm Monster Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'arma non comune.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the lunastra's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the lunastra or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Poison Susceptibility
entries: While {@condition poisoned}, the lunastra's Fire Aura is deactivated, it must land on its next turn, and is unable to fly until the {@condition poisoned} is removed. Once the {@condition poisoned} condition is removed, the lunastra's Fire Aura once again takes effect.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the lunastra moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a Bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lunastra makes three attacks; two claw attacks one bite or tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The lunastra exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The lunastra moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The lunastra makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Devil's Powder (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lunastra beats its wings releasing an explosive powder and creating a spark with her teeth. Each creature within 10 feet of the lunastra must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Lunastra is colored blue as opposed to {@creature Teostra|MHMM} who is red. Her horns are flatter and wider, making a sort of crown structure. They are known to breathe concentrated streams of fire, as well as cloak themselves in a scalding aura. Lunastra are high in the food chain, feeding on both coal, to fuel her fire abilities, and live prey like {@creature Apceros|MHMM}. Though Lunastra are powerful, they have to compete with other species like {@creature Rajang|MHMM}, {@creature Deviljho|MHMM}, and {@creature Akantor|MHMM}.

Lunastra, as fire dragons, naturally have expert control over fire. They can use this ability when hunting to ensure quick and devastating kills. Despite her large size, she is quick on foot and can easily chase down fast moving prey. Lunastra can also generate a fire aura around their bodies from their horns, which helps prevent brazen monsters like {@creature Tigrex|MHMM} from dealing serious damage to them. These adaptions enable Lunastra to become a formidable apex predator wherever she is. Their wings are covered in a powder that can be released and, at will, set a flame burning in the air resulting in explosions. This explosive powder is actually the Lunastra's old skin.

Lunastra are brutal female elder dragons, quick to attack at the first sign of trouble, though not as much as Teostra. In the ruins of the old Towers, Lunastra are commonly found in their nest together with Teostra.

This suggests that both actually stay in the nest together and guard their young. Though both haven't been seen in the nest together, both of their footprints can be found in the old nests and the active nests together.

items.name: Lunastra Scale
entries: {@i Tool Specialist.} Mentre indossi questa armatura, il tuo bonus di competenza è doppio per qualsiasi prova di abilità effettuata con uno strumento con cui sei esperto.

items.name: Lunastra Carapace
entries: While you wear this armor, any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee weapon attack takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage.

items.name: Lunastra Tail
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Lunastra Wing
entries: {@i Evade Window.} Questa armatura ha 3 rune e recupera 1d3 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Quando si fallisce un tiro salvezza di Destrezza mentre si indossa l'armatura, si può usare la reazione per spendere 1 runa per riuscire il tiro salvezza.

items.name: Lunastra Horn
entries: {@i Wide-Range.} Quando si usa {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}s, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}; tutte le altre creature entro un raggio di 3 metri da voi ottengono il suo effetto.

items.name: Lunastra Gem
entries: {@i Health Boost.} Quando si indossa questa armatura, i punti ferita massimi aumentano di 1 per ogni livello di personaggio posseduto.

items.name: Lunastra Scale
entries: {@i Guard.} You cannot be pushed or knocked backwards while you wield this weapon.

items.name: Lunastra Carapace
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 1.

items.name: Lunastra Tail
entries: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Lunastra Wing
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack using this weapon, you can engulf the target in flames. At the start of each of the engulfed creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage and it can then make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, putting out the flames on a successful save. Alternatively, the engulfed creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to smother the flames ending the effect. Once used, this property can't be used again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Lunastra Mane
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Una creatura colpita da quest'arma non può utilizzare un'azione con ricarica fino all'inizio del tuo prossimo turno. La creatura può comunque tirare per ricaricare la sua abilità alla fine del suo turno.

items.name: Lunastra Horn
entries: {@i Peak Performance.} Quando i punti ferita sono pieni e si tira un 1 o un 2 su un dado danno per un attacco effettuato con un'arma da mischia, si può rilanciare il dado e si deve usare il nuovo tiro, anche se il nuovo tiro è un 1 o un 2.

items.name: Lunastra Gem
entries: {@i Mind's Eye.} I tuoi attacchi con quest'arma aggirano le resistenze ai danni di qualsiasi creatura.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the maccao can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

The {@creature Great Maccao|MHMM} feathered crest sets them apart from its Maccao pack. Although superficially similar to its younger brethren, a Great Maccao is bigger and bulkier, with more brightly-colored plumage. It also has powerful legs it uses to kick threats and to move with great speed, and its spiked tail allows it to propel itself forward and jump with tremendous force.

Only male Maccaos or Great Maccaos have feathers on their head. A Maccao's tail is similar a kangaroo's tail. Its tail allows it to propel itself forward and jump with tremendous force. The Maccao has the ability to stand on its tail without any support from its legs, allowing it to balance itself on its tail with its legs in the air. While standing on its tail, its bright, red underbelly is revealed. The red underbelly acts as a warning sign, and is used to intimidate predators.
Maccao are scavengers that feed on corpses and eggs belonging to larger predators. Though primarily scavengers, Great Maccao will also feed on smaller monster species.

Great Maccao are shy monsters that prefer to stay away from most threats. Despite Great Maccao being the leader of its Maccao pack, it barely has any control over its lesser counterparts, unlike other Bird Wyverns such as the {@creature Great Jaggi|MHMM}. A Great Maccao's pack will rarely assist it in if it is in danger. Great Maccao would rather run than fight, much like its smaller counterparts.

items.name: Maccao Hide
entries: You and all of your possessions are completely odorless while you wear this armor.

items.name: Maccao Scale
entries: You have a +1 bonus to {@skill Performance} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Bird Wyvern Fang
entries: L'arma perforante infligge 1 danno perforante in più.

items.name: Sm Monster Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'arma non comune.

resist.note: when at least one body part is enhanced

trait.name: Hellfire
entries: Fire damage dealt by the magnamalo bypasses fire resistance and deals half damage to creatures that are immune to fire damage.

trait.name: Hellfire Dust
entries: At the start of each of the magnamalo's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite.

trait.name: Hellfire Jump
entries: As a bonus action the magnamalo can jump up to 120 feet into the air by jumping in 40-foot high increments in a zigzag pattern, using its hellfire to temporarily hover between jumps. During this jump, the magnamalo's horizontal movement can't exceed its speed and it takes no fall damage when it lands.

trait.name: Hellfire State
entries: At the start of the magnamalo's turn choose one body part: claws, tail, back, or mouth. That body part is enhanced with hellfire granting additional effects for the bite, claw, tail, hellfire divebomb actions (included in the action).
The parts remain enhanced until the magnamalo is knocked {@condition prone}, it hasn't attacked a creature for 1 minute, or ends the hellfire on all body parts as a bonus action.

When all four body parts are enhanced, the magnamalo's hellfire turns a magenta color, increasing its movement speed by 10 feet, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, and it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magnamalo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The magnamalo can use its frightful presence. It then makes two attacks: two with its claws,two with its tail, or two with its hellfire orbs.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage. If the mouth is enhanced by the hellfire state, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the claws are enhanced by the hellfire state, each creature within 5 feet of the target (including the target) must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orbs
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 30/120 ft., up to three targets. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the tail is enhanced by the hellfire state, choose two 5-foot cubed areas adjacent to the magnamalo or the target. Hellfire dust fills those spaces.

At the start of the magnamalo's next turn the hellfire dust explodes. Each creature within 5 feet of the dust must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Apex Predator
entries: The magnamalo feeds on the corpse of a creature that has a challenge rating equal to 1/2 or less than the magnamalo's challenge rating. A Medium or smaller creature is consumed whole, while the magnamalo can feed on a Large or bigger creature for up to 30 seconds. For each round the magnamalo feeds on a creature, it heals for an amount equal to the creature's challenge rating.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the magnamalo's choice that is within 120 feet of the magnamalo and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the magnamalo's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Hellfire Vortex {@recharge 5}
entries: The magnamalo releases a vortex of purple hellfire in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Bite Attack
entries: The magnamalo makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The magnamalo moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Detonate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The magnamalo's hellfire dust explodes (see tail attack).

legendary.name: Hellfire Divebomb (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The magnamalo leaps into the air, without provoking opportunity attacks, and uses its hellfire to propel it forward at high speeds, until comes crashing down in a 15-foot square area within 60 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

If the back is enhanced by the hellfire state, the dust on its body scatters and explodes in a 15-foot radius around the location it crashes into. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The magnamalo is a hulking fanged wyvern that bears some resemblance to a tiger. It is primarily clad in purple and yellow plates of armor, with a red underbelly. The head has a short, tigrine snout, holds two foldable tusks under its cheeks, and sports a large pair of jagged yellow horns resembling a samurai helmet. Both the forelegs and hindlegs end in four-clawed digits, and each foreleg is armed with a single large serrated blade, which is kept folded back, parallel with the leg. Magnamalo's tail ends in a spear-like tip composed of three spikes that can flex outwards to form a trident shape. Hidden within its back are a series of bone blades/spikes that spring out from its hide whenever it becomes enraged.

The magnamalo is a cunning beast that attacks with relentless assault. It is known to perform attacks back to back, striking before other attacks have followed through, leaving little chance for its adversaries to react.
The magnamalo is capable of creating mysterious purple flames from its mouth, tail, back, and forelegs known as "Hellfire". Despite its size, it is capable of leaping an astonishing distance.

The magnamalo uses its thin, sharp tail for several attacks as well, such as somersaulting while using the blades of its tail-tip to strike like a whip. All of its yellow carapaces are also capable of erecting. It can also release thick purple clouds of gas that detonate when Magnamalo flicks its tail into them.

Magnamalo is belligerent, and is extremely hostile towards monsters and hunters alike. It is shown multiple times attacking smaller monsters, such as {@creature Tobi-Kadachi|MHMM} or {@creature Arzuros|MHMM}, and carrying them in its jaws. In one instance, during a clash with {@creature Rathalos|MHMM}, when the Flying Wyvern tried to flee, Magnamalo quickly pounced onto its back. After some struggling, Magnamalo forced the both of them into a dive, sending itself and Rathalos crashing into the present Hunter in a fiery explosion. The battered Rathalos was blasted aside, with Magnamalo seemingly unharmed. The Magnamalo is powerful enough to go toe to toe with Elder Dragons such as the {@creature Teostra|MHMM}.

Magnamalo shows every 50 years in Kamura Village during the Rampage in order to feast on the many monsters that show up. Feeding on the monsters helps the Wyvern become stronger. It is highly feared by the village as Magnamalo almost destroyed said village 50 years ago.

items.name: Magnamalo Scale
entries: {@i Handicraft+2.} Per 24 ore, si acquisisce competenza con due strumenti artigianali a scelta ogni alba.

items.name: Magnamalo Shell
entries: When you jump while wearing this armor, you can use your bonus action to hover in the air. On subsequent turns you can use an action to remain hovering or jump again and hover in the new location.

items.name: Magnamalo Blade
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} Mentre si è sintonizzati con questa armatura, si può utilizzare qualsiasi oggetto consumabile, come pozioni o cibo, come azione bonus, a patto che siate voi a consumarlo.

items.name: Magnamalo Scute
entries: {@i Wide-Range.} Quando si usa {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}s, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}; tutte le altre creature entro un raggio di 3 metri da voi ottengono il suo effetto.

items.name: Magnamalo Tail
entries: When you are attuned to this armor, you can speak the armor's command word to conjure a samurai mask resembling the face of the magnamalo. While wearing the mask you have advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks. Additionally, this mask has 3 runes. You can use an action to expend 1 rune to release an aura of misery. Each creature within 30 feet of you that can see the mask must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw or is no longer incapacitated due to this masks effect is immune to the effect of this mask for 24 hours. This mask regains 1d3 expended runes daily at dawn.

items.name: Magna Ghostprism
entries: {@i Flinch Free.} Quando si indossa questa armatura non si può essere urtati {@condition prone} o spostati involontariamente dalla propria posizione attuale con qualsiasi mezzo.

items.name: Magnamalo Horn
entries: Si gode dell'immunità ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Magnamalo Plate
entries: {@i (This material must also follow weapon rules) Hellfire Cloak.} You have resistance to fire damage while you are wearing this armor. Additionally your armor has 3 runes that recharge daily at dawn. When you hit a creature with an melee weapon attack you can expend a rune to generate an explosion on impact. You can only expend one rune per round. The target and all creatures other than yourself within 5 feet of the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

items.name: Magnamalo Scale
entries: While attuned to this weapon you can use an action to speak its command word, causing magenta flames to envelope it. The flames shed bright magenta-colored light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. You can alter the radius as a bonus action. Speaking the command word again snuffs out the flames.

items.name: Magnamalo Shell
entries: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Magnamalo Blade
entries: {@i (Bow only)} While attuned to this weapon, blades appear on the limbs of the bow. Additionally you can make a special melee weapon attack with it using your Strength or Dexterity modifier. If you hit with this attack, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 + your modifier used to make the attack.

items.name: Magnamalo Scute
entries: {@i (Bowgun only)} When you hit a creature with your {@item demon ammo (1)|AGMH|demon ammo} a second time, the duration no longer refreshes, but the damage bonus provided by the demon ammo increases to +4.

items.name: Magnamalo Tail
entries: {@i Hellfire Orbs.} While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell chromatic orb} spell (+9 to hit) three times. Each chromatic orb must target a different creature, and deals fire damage. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: Magna Ghostprism
entries: Quando si è sintonizzati con quest'arma, si ottiene un bonus di +2 ai tiri di attacco e alle DC di tiro salvezza degli incantesimi. Questo bonus aumenta a +3 quando l'incantesimo che si sta lanciando infligge danni da fuoco.

items.name: Magnamalo Horn
entries: {@i Resentment.} Fino alla fine del proprio turno, si ottiene un bonus di +1 ai tiri per colpire e ai tiri per colpire contro qualsiasi creatura che abbia subito danni dalla fine del proprio ultimo turno.

items.name: Magnamalo Plate
entries: {@i Hellfire.} While you are attuned to this weapon, your fire damage bypasses a creature resistance and deals half damage to a creature that is immune to fire damage.

monster.name: Malfestio
languages: understands Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can't speak them

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The malfestio doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach .

trait.name: Keen Hearing And Sight
entries: The malfestio has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The malfestio has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The malfestio makes four attacks, two with its Tail and two with its talons.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Sonic Wave (recharge 5-6)
entries: The malfestio releases Sonic Wave in a 30 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or, they fall {@condition Unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Malfestio superficially resembles an owl. Its body is covered in blue plumage with a grayish belly, a yellow collar, and a white face with a small beak and red eyes. On its head are long tufts that point back and are tipped with yellow. There are hints of yellow on its legs that end in scaly feet that have two talons and one small vestigial toe. Its wings have bright blue membranes. Along its wings are long blade-like claws. Its flattened tail ends in a three-pointed shape.

Malfestio is a nocturnal predator that uses its talons and wing claws to attack prey. Like {@creature Nargacuga|MHMM}, it sleeps in trees to avoid terrestrial predators. It can produce an ultrasound beam that can easily put prey to sleep. The claws along its wings are usually hidden but are revealed once the malfestio feels threatened.

items.name: Azurefeather
entries: You have a +2 bonus to {@skill Insight} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Malfestio Wingtalon
entries: Whenever you make a saving throw against the {@condition unconscious} condition or other sleep-like effects, you do so with a +3 bonus.

items.name: Malfestio Ear
entries: {@i Detect+.} You gain a +2 bonus to your passive {@skill Perception} while you wear this armor.

items.name: Malfestio Wing
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight while you wear this armor. In conditions of clear visibility, you can make out details of even extremely distant creatures and objects as small as 2 feet across.

items.name: Malfestio Tailfeather
entries: While wearing this armor, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, your sight range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Malfestio Webbing
entries: Your armor becomes light and flexible. If it is medium or light armor it can be worn under normal clothes. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks or has a Strength requirement, it no longer does.

items.name: Azurefeather
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can speak its command word and swing it in a horizonal fashion to release a sonic wave in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or, be {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. If they fail the save by 5 or more they instead fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, until the sleeper takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Malfestio Wingtalon
entries: L'arma infligge 1d4 danni da taglio in più.

items.name: Malfestio Ear
entries: {@i Hunter.} While attuned to this weapon you gain one extra ration from whatever you hunt.

items.name: Malfestio Wing
entries: Your weapon has 3 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its runes, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the weapon pulses and points at the one nearest to you. This weapon regains 1d3 expended runes daily at dawn.

items.name: Malfestio Tailfeather
entries: {@i (Ranger only)} While attuned to this weapon you can cast the {@spell zephyr strike|XGE} (XG 171) spell once a day, without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Malfestio Webbing
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit.} Quando si ha vantaggio su un tiro di attacco con quest'arma e si colpisce il bersaglio, si può far infliggere alla propria arma il massimo dei danni se il più basso dei due tiri di d20 colpirebbe anche il bersaglio (tutti i dadi di danno extra devono essere comunque tirati). Si può usare questa proprietà un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Forza o Destrezza (a scelta), recuperando tutti gli utilizzi al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: Malfestio Goldfeather
entries: While you are holding this weapon, you can use an action to speak its command word to summon a {@creature giant owl} for up to 8 hours. The owl can telepathically communicate with you at any range if you and it are on the same plane of existence. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed.

items.name: Coma Sac
entries: A Material that replaces the {@table plants|AGMH|sleep herb} when crafting {@item sleep coating|AGMH} or {@item sleep ammo (1)|AGMH|sleep ammo} (100 uses before it is destroyed).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wild melynx makes two mace attacks.

action.name: Catspaw Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) danni da percosse.

action.name: Flash Bomb (1/day)
entries: The melynx slams a bulb of blinding powder onto the ground in front of it. All creatures within 30 feet of the melynx must make a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect.
Melynx are noted for their black fur and the ability to talk in human language, as well as do human activities like their fellow Lynian subspecies called the {@creature Felyne|MHMM}s.

Melynx are quite intelligent. Melynx are able to build tools, trade with other Lynian tribes, and even settle in settlements. Melynx in human villages sometimes take job opportunities, mostly as Felyne Chefs and/or Felyne Comrades. Felyne Chefs cook food for their customer to support them in their adventures by temporarily enhancing their abilities. Melynx are quite intelligent.

{@creature Wild Melynx|MHMM} appear in groups and have a tendency to rob hunters of their items so they can see how valuable said item is. Once they obtain an item, they run away and dig underground. Secluded, they'll look at the item and consider if its valuable or not. If it is valuable they'll either sell it, trade it, or give it away to another Lynian tribe. If it isn't valuable they may just intentionally leave it behind somewhere random. If items are stolen by a Melynx than there is chance that one could get it back by looking for a crude statue of a Felyne with paint on it. Some items can be recovered here.

They live in harmony with the lighter-toned species of Lynian, the Felynes. The Melynx and Felynes seem to be hostile towards the other Lynian Species, the {@creature Shakalaka|MHMM}, as they are never seen living in the same area together, though all three species live in the same environments.

items.name: Ration (1 day)
entries: Queste razioni consistono in frutta secca e in un tipo di carne animale adatto a un viaggio prolungato.

items.name: Coins
entries: The melynx has {@dice 2d6} silver pieces on them.

items.name: Secret Stash+
entries: A pouch carried by a melynx. Full of miscellaneous junk. Can be sold for 50 gp.

items.name: Shock Trap
entries: {@item shock trap|AGMH|Item found in (AGtMH p.57)}.

trait.name: Oiled Body
entries: The mizutsune has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mizutsune makes three attacks, one with its bite and two with its tail. It can make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the creature is {@condition Slick|MHMM}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the mizutsune can't use its bite on another target.

action.name: Bubble Prison
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition Slick|MHMM} and enclosed in a bubble of shimmering force for 1 minute or until the bubble is destroyed. Nothing, not physical Objects, energy, or other spell effects, can pass through the bubble, in or out, though a creature in the Sphere can breathe there. A creature inside of the bubble has disadvantage on attacks due to its slippery nature. The bubble has AC 15, 30 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerable to piercing damage. At the end of the mizutsune's turn all bubbles rise 10 feet higher into the air.

action.name: Hydropump {@recharge 5}
entries: The mizutsune releases a high pressure stream of water in an 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage and not on a successful one.

reaction.name: Tail Sweep
entries: When a create is slick and starts its turn within 10 feet of the mizutsune. It can use its reaction to sweep its tail, hitting the targets legs. The target must then make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Like most other Leviathans, Mizutsune has a long, slender body. However, it is one of the few Leviathans to actually have fur on its body. This fur covers its chest, underbelly, legs and tail. Its scales are light colored and resemble those of a fish. Its head has a long snout and is beautifully adorned by many fin-like appendages. These fins are pink with yellow markings, and they can also be seen on its back and tail. Its feet are said to be quite different from other Leviathans and allow Mizutsune to move swiftly on land.

Mizutsune's most unique adaption is its ability to produce bubbles. It is able to produce the bubbles by using special fluid secretions, produced from its own body along with water, and rubbing its hairs in the secretions. These stiff yet soft purple hairs are found on its chest, tail, legs, and sides. The hairs are used for sliding on the fluids it produces, spreading the fluids, and even using the fluids to produce more bubbles. Mizutsune can also breath these bubbly fluids from its mouth. It is known to use the bubbles it produces both offensively and defensively in battle. It uses the bubbles to help it move faster and to make it more flexible in battle, while simultaneously impeding the movement of any foes. In order to stop itself quickly while moving, Mizutsune has special hook-like claws that allow it to stop sliding quickly to face threats and not leave itself open. Despite Mizutsune's strange appearance, the fins it has actually act as receptors for detecting the presence of predators and prey coming through vibrations in the secretions. Like a snake, Mizutsune's teeth are recurved to prevent prey from escaping easily. Its jaws are even designed like a snake to an extent, even being able to open its mouth wide and swallow some large prey. It can also fire pressurized jets of water from its mouth, much like {@creature Plesioth|MHMM}.

Mizutsune are rather calm in nature until provoked. They prefer to be left alone resting near large bodies of water, while covered in their special secretions. They prefer to avoid confrontations, however, will defend themselves if need be. Once a threat has left, Mizutsune won't chase after the threat but will instead let it go. Though Mizutsune are usually calm, they are known to turn aggressive during Breeding Season. Mizutsune become aggressive or even berserk during their Breeding Season. In this season, it is not a good idea to go fishing from them being known to injure people due to their blind rage. Male Mizutsune have large fins and are able to flash their fins red to show emotion to the female Mizutsune, in order to attract them.

items.name: Mizutsune Scale
entries: {@i Gourmand.} While attuned to this armor, you double the amount of days you can go without food or water before suffering a level of {@condition exhaustion}.

items.name: Bubble Fluid
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can cast the {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere} spell once per day.

items.name: Mizutsune Pelt
entries: While wearing this armor, you ignore difficult terrain from spells like {@spell grease} or other environmental effects that cause the ground to become slippery. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition slick|MHMM} condition.

items.name: Mizutsune Purplefur
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da freddo quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Mizutsune Plate
entries: While attuned to this armor, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks that rely on moving silently.

items.name: Mizutsune Water Gem
entries: {@i Bubbly+.} While attuned to this armor, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. Also the durations from slowing effects, such as the {@spell slow} spell or a copper dragon's breath attack, are reduced by half.

items.name: Mizutsune Claw
entries: Quando si impugna quest'arma, si ottiene un bonus di +1 ai tiri di attacco con incantesimo e si ignora mezza copertura quando si effettua un attacco con incantesimo.

items.name: Bubble Fluid
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, the creature must succeed a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition slick|MHMM}. A creature can use its action on itself or another adjacent creature to wipe off the liquid, removing the effect.

items.name: Mizutsune Tail
entries: This weapon has 5 runes. While holding it, you can use an action and expend 1 rune to speak its command word. For the next minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature hostile to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you. The weapon can sense the presence of hostile creatures that are ethereal, {@condition Invisible}, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight. The effect ends if you stop holding the weapon. This weapon regains 1d4 + 1 expended runes daily at dawn.

items.name: Mizutsune Fin
entries: {@i (Hunting Horn only)} Your maximum cord length is increased by 1 when holding this weapon.

items.name: Mizutsune Plate
entries: {@i Crisis.} While suffering from an abnormal status effect, such as {@condition poisoned}, burning, slowed, {@condition blinded}, etc, all attacks and spells deal an extra 1d10 spell or weapon damage.

items.name: Mizutsune Water Gem
entries: {@i (spellcaster only)} While attuned to this weapon, you know the {@spell watery sphere|XGE} spell. If you prepare spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If this spell is not on your class list, the spell is nonetheless a class spell for you.

trait.name: Underground Charge
entries: If the monoblos moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while underground, it can then make a horn attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the monoblos takes 30 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the monoblos hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monoblos makes two attacks, one with its horn and one with its tail attack.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Violent Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The monoblos roars loudly in a 10 foot radius around them. All creatures in this area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) thunder damage and become {@condition Deafened} for 1 minute on a failed saving throw or half as much on a successful one and is not {@condition deafened}.
A monocerous desert-dwelling wyvern, they have a brown, rock-hard texture to their shell.

While Monoblos have no breath attack, their roar is considered a lethal weapon itself. They are also very physically capable, able to fight off adventurers with horn-thrusts and tail-swings. Being able to tunnel beneath the sands of the Desert also means they can sneak up on any potential threats.
Monoblos are aggressive, and will attack adventurers on sight. They are quick to anger, causing their crown to be become inflamed with red streaks.

items.name: Monoblos Carapace
entries: {@i Botanist+.} Quando si riesce a raccogliere una risorsa {@table plants|AGMH|plant}, se ne raccolgono 1d4 in più.

items.name: Monoblos Thoracic
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da freddo quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Scarlet Finehorn
entries: While you're wearing this armor, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

items.name: Blos Medulla
entries: {@i Alert.} Non si può essere sorpresi mentre si è coscienti.

items.name: Blos Gem
entries: You have a +1 bonus to your AC while you wear this armor.

items.name: Monoblos Heart
entries: {@i Adrenaline.} La prima volta che si scende sotto la metà dei propri punti ferita in combattimento, si ottiene una scarica di adrenalina. Al prossimo turno la velocità di movimento raddoppia e si può compiere un'azione extra.

items.name: Monoblos Carapace
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can perform the somatic components of spells even when you have weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

items.name: Monoblos Thoracic
entries: Whenever you have advantage on a melee attack roll with this weapon and hit, you can knock the target {@condition prone} if the lower of the two d20 rolls would also hit the target.

items.name: Scarlet Finehorn
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 piercing damage.

items.name: Blos Medulla
entries: {@i Charger.} When you use your action to {@action Dash}, you can use a bonus action to shove a creature.

items.name: Blos Gem
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Load Up+.} While attuned to this weapon, you increase the maximum capacity for all of your ammo by 2.

items.name: Monoblos Heart
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 1.

trait.name: Sure-footed
entries: The moofah has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

Moofah are docile alpaca-like creatures known for their long shaggy fur. Males have longer horns than females. Domesticated Moofah have lighter-colored fur than their wild counterparts, and wear colored bows and bells.

items.name: Moofah Fur
entries: Riduci di 2 i danni da freddo subiti mentre indossi questa armatura.

items.name: Moofah Horn
entries: Your weapon attacks deal an extra 1 lightning damage.

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: Fornisce una razione di 2 giorni se cucinato.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The gekko sheds dim light in a 1-foot radius around it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}1 danni perforanti.

trait.name: Mushroom Hunter
entries: The mosswine advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell when hunting mushrooms.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

Mosswine are small, moss-covered pigs. They have a gray, spiky head plate. Mosswine are known to have a great appetite for mushrooms. Hunters and marketers commonly observe them to identify an area of Special {@table Mushrooms|AGMH}. Mosswine are docile by nature, but will attack if provoked. They are mostly hunted for their mushroom-tracking abilities and their meat.

items.name: Mosswine Hide
entries: {@i Mushroomancer.} While wearing this armor you can digest {@table mushrooms|AGMH} that would otherwise be inedible and gain their advantageous effects. The more Mosswine Hide materials equipped in your armor or trinkets, the more mushrooms you can eat.

entries.name: 1 Mosswine Hide
items: Toadstool, {@i You regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute.}

entries.name: 2 Mosswine Hides
items: Nitroshroom, {@i Your Strength score increases by +2 for 1 minute (to a maximum of 20).}
Parashroom, {@i Your AC becomes 13 + your Dexterity modifier for the next 8 hours.}

entries.name: 3 Mosswine Hides
items: Fungo del Caos, {@i You are {@condition poisoned} per 1 ora, e guadagna 5 punti ferita temporanei per livello del personaggio per i successivi 10 minuti.}
Bindshroom, {@i Your speed increases by 10 feet for 1 hour.}
Exciteshroom, {@i Provides one of the other mushroom effects, roll a d6 to see which one:}

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: Fornisce una razione di 2 giorni se cucinato.

items.name: Blue Mushroom
entries: {@table mushrooms|AGMH|Item found in (AGtMH p.70)}

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The najarala has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Surround
entries: The najarala can freely enter a large or smaller creatures space. If the creature is within the inner space of the najarala it is surrounded. A surrounded creature is trapped (escape {@dc 17}) by the najarala's body. A creature can also escape by flying or burrowing out of the area.

trait.name: Squeeze
entries: As a bonus action, the najarala can use its constrict against a {@condition grappled} creature or one within the najarala's space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The najarala makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target. Or it makes two sonic scale attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the najarala can't constrict another target.

action.name: Sonic Scale
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) force damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.

action.name: Sonic Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The najarala exhales a blast of force in a 90-line. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 39 ({@damage 11d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Najarala is a large Snake Wyvern with bright green skin adorned with large orange-yellow plates on its back and tail. It has a long serpentine body with small though fully functional fore- and hindlimbs that aid it in moving around on uneven ground. Najarala are stealthy hunters that ruthlessly ambush their targets. It has a large beak-like mouth similar to that of a parrot. This beak is used to rip chunks of flesh from its prey and then swallow said chunks whole. While feeding on prey, it will use its arms to hold on to its prey while ripping off chunks of flesh.

The length of a Najarala surpasses some of the largest leviathans such as {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM} or {@creature Lagiacrus|MHMM}. As many would notice these creatures have short, yet powerful arms and legs. At first glance these limbs appear to be useless but in reality they enable the creatures to support itself when rearing up. Another fascinating feature is that the creature has a specialized organ on its back that is vibrated by air and creates unique sound waves. This auditory organ has a biological effect in the surrounding area. Najarala have beautiful plates on both its neck and tail that will rattle when upset, giving unwelcome creatures an early warning. The plates on its tail can be thrown at its enemies and will explode creating a loud burst of sound like a sonic bomb. This will stun both prey and enemies alike.

items.name: Najarala Shell
entries: Mentre si indossa questa armatura, si può usare una reazione o un'azione bonus per ottenere resistenza ai danni da fuoco fino alla fine del proprio turno successivo. Si può usare questa proprietà due volte, e si possono recuperare tutti gli usi al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: Najarala Hide
entries: {@i Earplugs.} Mentre si è sintonizzati con questa armatura, si può usare un'azione bonus per evocare due tappi per le orecchie di forma a scelta. Mentre si usano questi tappi per le orecchie, si è considerati {@condition deafened} e si ha vantaggio nei tiri salvezza contro i danni da tuono. È possibile dissipare i tappi per le orecchie come azione bonus per porre fine all'effetto di assordamento.

items.name: N.Paralysis Sac
entries: Non si può essere {@condition paralyzed} mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Chilling Beak
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni necrotici quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Najarala Shell
entries: {@i Capturer.} When you capture a creature, you gain one additional material from it.

items.name: Najarala Fang
entries: L'arma infligge 1d4 danni da taglio in più.

items.name: Najarala Sounder
entries: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da taglio in più.

items.name: N.Paralysis Sac
entries: This weapon has 3 runes which are regained every day at dawn. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you may expend a rune to have the target make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a fail the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has its movement speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. The creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Najarala Marrow
entries: {@i Capture Expert.} {@item Tranq bomb|AGMH}s & {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|ammo} roll an extra 3d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: Chilling Beak
entries: {@i (Melee Weapon only)} When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to reduce the damage you deal by half to {@action grapple} the target.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nakarkos fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Poison Aura
entries: At the start of each of the nakarkos's turns, each creature within 5 feet of its body takes 11 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. A creature that touches the nakarkos body or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Bone Tentacles
entries: The nakarkos has two tentacles (Size. Large, AC 22, HP 30). Damaging a bone tentacle deals no damage to the nakarkos. When a bone tentacle reaches 0 hit points, it becomes a Broken Tentacle. As a bonus action, the tentacles retract underground and reappear in an unoccupied space within 15 feet of the narkarkos body.

trait.name: Broken Tentacles
entries: A broken tentacle has had the bones protecting it destroyed reducing its AC by 2. (Size. Large, AC 20). Damaging a broken tentacle deals damage to the nakarkos. At the end of the nakarkos turn, a broken tentacle retracts into the ground. It reappears at the start of the nakarkos next turn with the bones of a new creature, roll a {@dice d4} to determine what type of tentacle it becomes. On a 1, Lagiacrus Tentacle; On a 2, Glavenus Tentacle; On a 3, Uragaan Tentacle; On a 4, Brachydios Tentacle.

trait.name: True Face
entries: The Nakarkos is sunken into the ground, revealing only its body parts that are covered in dragon bone giving the appearance that it has "two heads" but nakarkos's true head is hidden away underground. When the nakarkos is below half of its maximum hit points (131), it will reveal its unprotected true face reducing its AC by 2 and replacing its multiattack and fire beam with:

items.name: Multiattack
entries: The nakarkos makes two tentacle attacks and one beak attack. It can replace its tentacle attack with a sticky mucus attack.

items.name: Fire Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The nakarkos exhales a beam of fire in a 90-foot line that is 10-feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 50 ({@damage 9d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nakarkos makes two tentacle attacks. It can replace either of these attacks with a Sticky Mucus attack.

action.name: Sticky Mucus
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 30/120 ft. from tentacles location, one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage. On hit, the target is {@condition grappled} by the mucus (escape {@dc 20}).

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fire Beam {@recharge 5}
entries: The nakarkos tentacles release two beams of fire, one from each tentacle. Each beam fires in a 45-foot line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in either line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 44 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: The nakarkos uses one of the following tentacle attacks depending on which bones they are using:

items.name: Broken Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

items.name: Lagiacrus Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage.

items.name: Glavenus Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

items.name: Uragaan Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) blugeoning damage.

items.name: Brachydios Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and each creature within 5 feet of the target, including the target, must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Mucus Ball
entries: The narkarkos launches a ball of mucus from its back at a target. The target must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the mucus (escape {@dc 20}).

legendary.name: Tentacle Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The narkarkos makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The narkarkos moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the narkarkos moves through must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Nakarkos are massive cephalopod-like monsters. They have glowing yellow eyes, and massive, sharp beaks. They have blue skin with spots of turquoise bioluminescence. The most unique feature of a Nakarkos's body is its self-made covering of bones which it uses to protect and camouflage itself. Under normal circumstances, the Nakarkos's face cannot be seen. Its two primary tentacles are covered in vertebrae and tipped with skulls, creating the appearance of a two-headed skeletal dragon. Nakarkos have been reported in many different regions by eyewitnesses, though Nakarkos are known to make huge bone-covered lairs in caves. These lairs are known as Wyvern's End. Nakarkos are also known to be found in the sea.

Nakarkos easily assert themselves as top predators, no matter what the environment is. These Elder Dragons have been identified feeding on the armored prey, such as {@creature Uragaan|MHMM} and {@creature Diablos|MHMM}, and even top predators like {@creature Glavenus|MHMM}, {@creature Brachydios|MHMM}, and {@creature Agnaktor|MHMM}. Even monster species capable of flight aren't safe from this monster. The most shocking creatures these Elder Dragons have been found to take down are {@creature Shen Gaoren|MHMM} and {@creature Ceadeus|MHMM} pups. Other prey includes {@creature Hermitaur|MHMM} and {@creature Daimyo Hermitaur|MHMM}. The only real likely things that could potentially threaten a Nakarkos are other Elder Dragons like older Ceadeus, their only known predator.

Nakarkos are gluttons that can eat a whole ecosystem if left unchecked. Due to Nakarkos having huge appetites, they can easily wipe out all life in surrounding areas. Nakarkos have even been reported shooting down airships for food. Though Nakarkos can destroy an ecosystem, it doesn't actually want to do that. It prefers to leave its nest in search of prey so, it still have plenty of food at the environment it is living within. If the adventurer's Guild finds a Nakarkos' lair, they will immediately send adventurer to repel it before it can bring further damage to that ecosystem. However, it is said that Nakarkos will eventually return to said area in order to feed themselves further.

Nakarkos is able to produce an eerie, blue mucus from its body. This mucus is sticky, allowing it to capture prey and even shoot prey items out of the air. Though this mucus is used for capturing prey, Nakarkos has another use for the mucus. This mucus is used to help prevent bones from corroding, sticking bones together, and to prevent the bones from collapsing. With this mucus, it can make a protective bone armor to protect its whole body from attacks and even use some bones as weapons. Like a cuttlefish, it has sticky tentacles used to drag prey back to its lair. These tentacles are usually covered in bones for protection, ending with a huge skull. But this isn't just limited to skulls. Nakarkos has been seen using various monster parts to attack foes or to kill prey with. Some of these parts are hard to identify due to Nakarkos altering their shapes in order for it to use them. Some parts that it has been seen using is a fused together Glavenus jaw and tail, a {@creature Lagiacrus|MHMM}'s shell shockers, a Brachydios's pounders, and a Uragaan's chin.

These various parts give the appearance that it has "two heads" but Nakarkos's true head is hidden away underground most of the time. When it feels its life is truly in danger, it will eventually reveal its true face. Its true face is cephalopod-like, resembling a cuttlefish. By revealing its face, it can use its bone-crunching beak. So to make it easier for itself to use the Fire Beam, it will fire the element from its tentacles and build it up in its mouth before firing a massive beam. To move quickly, Nakarkos has jet propulsion like squids. It uses this to return to its nest at a quicker rate, so it can avoid getting eaten itself.

items.name: Nakarkos Hide
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Nakarkos Arm Brace
entries: {@i Adrenaline.} La prima volta che si scende sotto la metà dei propri punti ferita in combattimento, si ottiene una scarica di adrenalina. Al prossimo turno la velocità di movimento raddoppia e si può compiere un'azione extra.

items.name: Nakarkos Cuttlebone
entries: {@i Survivor+.} Quando un alleato, che si può vedere, è ridotto a 0 punti ferita, si può usare la propria reazione per guadagnare +2 CA, +2 danni e +2 ai tiri per colpire per 1 minuto. Una volta usata, questa proprietà non può essere riutilizzata fino all'alba successiva.

items.name: Nakarkos Soul Orb
entries: {@i (Sorcerer, Warlock, and Wizard only)} This armor has two runes that it regains daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one of these runes to cast {@spell armor of agathys} at 5th level. When the spell deals its damage, it deals it as piercing damage instead of as cold damage.

items.name: Nakarkos Hide
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Una creatura colpita da quest'arma non può utilizzare un'azione con ricarica fino all'inizio del tuo prossimo turno. La creatura può comunque tirare per ricaricare la sua abilità alla fine del suo turno.

items.name: S.Dalamadur Gazer
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Bonus Shot.} Quando si effettua l'azione di attacco, si può effettuare un attacco aggiuntivo con quest'arma come azione bonus.

items.name: Nakarkos Arm Brace
entries: {@i Furor.} When you are below one-tenth of your maximum hit points, your melee weapon attacks with this weapon deal maximum damage.

items.name: Radiant Mucus
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use your bonus action to transform the weapon into a {@item tentacle rod|DMG} (DMG 208) or back to its original form. Each tentacle on the rod has a different damage type: tentacle one, fire; tentacle two, lightning; tentacle three, bludgeoning.

items.name: Nakarkos Cuttlebone
entries: {@i Crisis+.} While suffering from an abnormal status effect, such as {@condition poisoned}, burning, slowed, {@condition blinded}, etc, all attacks and spells deal an extra 1d12 spell or weapon damage.

items.name: Nakarkos Fang
entries: {@i Trump Card.} You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition grappled}.

items.name: Nakarkos Soul Orb
entries: {@i Amplify.} The elemental damage done by your weapon is increased by one die size and the duration of consumables is increased by 50%.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Le namielle possono respirare aria e acqua.

trait.name: Flooded
entries: Any space that has been flooded by one of namielle's actions is filled with two to three feet of water, and it is difficult terrain for any creature without a innate or magical swimming speed. The flooded areas remain flooded for 24 hours, until the namielle absorbs the water, or until it is turned to steam.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The namielle's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save {@dc 18}), requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The namielle makes two attacks: one attack with its bite and one with its claw, or it makes two attacks with its water globule.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Water Globule
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or become affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a hit or miss, the 5 foot area below the target is flooded.

action.name: Tidal Wave
entries: The namielle conjures up a wave of water that crashes down on an area in front of it. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

action.name: Maelstrom
entries: The water in a 30-foot radius around the namielle is pulled towards it and absorbed into its body, increasing its AC by 2 until the end of its next turn. Each creature in flooded terrain must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the namielle on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and is not pulled.

action.name: Electric Divebomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The namielle releases a torrent of water from its body, flooding the ground in a 30-foot radius around it. It then rises into the sky while gathering electricity and comes crashing down at its same location causing a massive eruption of water and a shockwave of steam. Each creature within 30 feet of the namielle must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the creature is within 10 feet of the namielle, it takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Il namielle compie un solo attacco con il morso o con il globulo d'acqua.

legendary.name: Water Beam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The namielle exhales a torrent of water in an 60-foot cone, flooding the area. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage and be affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

legendary.name: Electric Current (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The namielle touches the tip of its wing to a flooded space within 10 feet of it, sending an electric current coursing through it. This current travels through each connected flooded space causing an explosion of steam in each space as it travels through them. Each creature in those spaces must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Spaces affected by this ability then lose the flooded status.

Namielle è un Drago Anziano che ha aspetti di mante, pesci d'alto mare e meduse. Le sue ali massicce sono colorate di nero sopra e di azzurro sotto, con una luminescenza arcobaleno che pulsa costantemente. La testa è rossa e blu con la stessa luminescenza pulsante, ma quando viene svuotata dell'acqua e asciugata, presenta una colorazione lattiginosa che interessa sia il corpo che la parte inferiore delle ali. Presenta inoltre numerosi e lunghi baffi sulla mascella inferiore.

Come la maggior parte dei Draghi Anziani, la maggior parte dei mostri fugge dalla sua sola presenza. Si afferma come il vertice della catena alimentare. Ciò che consuma, tuttavia, è un mistero. In base alla sua struttura dentale aghiforme, si può ipotizzare che si nutra di pesci e, forse, di wyvern di piscina.
