Mentre la si indossa, si può usare un'azione per spendere 1 runa dell'armatura e farle emettere uno dei seguenti suoni entro un raggio di 60 piedi: il cinguettio di un fringuello, il gracchiare di un corvo, lo starnazzare di un'anatra, il chiocciare di un pollo, il clacson di un'oca, il richiamo di un loon, il ghigno di un tacchino, il grido di un gabbiano, lo schiamazzo di un gufo o l'urlo di un'aquila.
Questa armatura recupera 1d6 + 4 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Se si consuma l'ultima runa, tirare un d20. Con un 1, le rune non si ricaricano per una settimana.

items.name: Qurupeco Scale
entries: Si acquisisce competenza con gli strumenti musicali {@item horn|PHB}. Se si è già esperti, il bonus di competenza raddoppia quando lo si usa.

items.name: Qurupeco Feather
entries: Mentre si impugna quest'arma, si può usare un'azione per evocare un {@creature jaggi|MHMM} in proprio aiuto per 1 ora. Agirà nel vostro turno di iniziativa e fuggirà se voi o i vostri alleati tenterete di fargli del male. Una volta utilizzata questa proprietà, non è possibile utilizzarla nuovamente per una settimana.

items.name: Vivid Feather
entries: Mentre si è sintonizzati con quest'arma, si può usare quest'arma come fuoco dell'incantesimo.

items.name: Alluring Beak
entries: Quando si colpisce una creatura con quest'arma, essa deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza {@dc 12}. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, il bersaglio diventa {@condition charmed} da voi fino alla fine del suo turno successivo. Se il tiro salvezza riesce, il bersaglio diventa immune a questo effetto per 24 ore.

items.name: Flintstone
entries: Quando si lancia un incantesimo che infligge danni da fuoco, si ottiene un bonus di +1 al tiro di attacco dell'incantesimo.

items.name: Screamer Sac
entries: Un materiale per l'artigianato utilizzato per la produzione di {@item sonic bomb|AGMH}.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Materiale raro per il potenziamento dell'armatura.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Web (2/long rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The rachnoid exhales fire in a 15-foot line that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc l2} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The infant form of {@creature Rakna-Kadaki|MHMM}. At this stage in their life cycle, they cling to their mother's abdomen, feeding on scraps of her regurgitated prey. From birth, they are instantly able to spit webs that are just as strong as their mother's, which they use to bind prey or swiftly move about at her command.

items.name: Rachnoid Silk
entries: While you are grappling a target you can use an action to speak this armor's command word, causing rachnoid silk covering your armor to wrap around the {@condition grappled} target. Until you or the creature takes fire damage, or until it breaks free of your grapple, it has disadvantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Sharp claw
entries: L'arma da taglio infligge 1 danno da taglio in più.

items.name: Rachnoid Silk
entries: Can be used to craft {@item pitfall trap|AGMH} (AGtMH p.63) by combining it with a {@item trap tool|AGMH} using {@item smith's tools|PHB} ({@dc 15}).

items.name: Monster Fluid
entries: Materiale di potenziamento non comune o raro che può essere utilizzato per armi o armature.

trait.name: Bone Armor
entries: The Radobaan is covered in the bones of fallen creatures granting it +4 AC. When the radobaan takes more than 30 damage in a single turn, the bones snap and break reducing the bonus AC by 1.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The radobaan makes one tail attack and two chin slam attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Chin Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Roll {@recharge 5}
entries: The radobaan rolls its body into a wheel and moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking opportunity attacks. Any creatures the radobaan moves through must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 42 ({@damage 12d6}) slashing damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sleeping Gas (2/Day)
entries: The radobaan releases sleeping gas from its underside. All creatures within 15 ft. must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or, they fall {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake.

Radobaan looks very similar to {@creature Uragaan|MHMM} in many aspects but has its own unique features. Unlike Uragaan, Radobaan is covered in a tar-like substance that sticks rows of bones onto its body. These bones vary in size throughout the Radobaan's body but the most distinctive ones are on its legs. The bones on its legs are the horns of {@creature Diablos|MHMM}. Though the bones aren't as strong as ore, they are lighter. This lighter weight makes Radobaan faster than Uragaan. Despite not eating ore, Radobaan still has a massive chin like Uragaan. Like Uragaan, Radobaan can roll into a wheel and run over enemies.

It also can emit coma-inducing gas from its body like Uragaan. Radobaan can be fairly calm unless provoked by a threat unlike their ore eating relatives the Uraagan which will become hostile regardless of being threatened or not. Once provoked, they will turn violent.

items.name: Radobaan Shell
entries: {@i Guard.} Non si può essere spinti o colpiti all'indietro mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Radobaan Scale
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Radobaan Oilshell
entries: {@i Tremor-Proof.} Non si può essere colpiti {@condition prone} mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Radobaan Marrow
entries: {@i Negate Bleeding.} Si è immuni agli effetti di ferita, come la ferita sanguinante del {@creature Odogaron|MHMM} o la ferita infernale del {@creature bearded devil} mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Radobaan Gem
entries: While you wear this armor, any creature that hits you with a melee weapon, an unarmed strike, or a natural melee weapon takes {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

items.name: R.Sleep Sac
entries: This weapon has 4 runes. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 of its runes to have the target make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, or it falls {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute, until the sleeper takes damage, or until someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. This weapon regains 1 expended rune daily at dawn.

items.name: R.Sleep Sac
entries: A Material that replaces the {@table plants|AGMH|sleep herb} when crafting {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s or {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo}. (100 uses).

trait.name: Detonate
entries: At the start of the brachydios' turn, the slime explodes. Each creature in the slimes area, takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the brachydios fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Raging Fury
entries: While it has half hit points or fewer, the brachydios gains the following benefits:

items: The brachydios' AC is increased by 3.
It has resistance to bludgeoning damage and vulnerability to cold damage.
It cannot be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition poisoned}.
Its slime now explodes on initiative 20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Il brachidio effettua tre attacchi: uno con il corno e due con il pugno.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage + 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and green slime covers the terrain in a 10-foot radius around the target (including the target's space).

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage + 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and green slime covers the terrain in a 5-foot radius around the target (including the target's space).

action.name: Chemical Reaction {@recharge 5}
entries: Il brachydios sbatte il suo corno sul terreno e provoca una catena di esplosioni in una linea di 60 piedi e larga 3 metri. Ogni creatura in quella linea deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Destrezza {@dc 19}, subendo 22 ({@damage 5d8}) danni da fuoco + 18 ({@damage 4d8}) danni da percosse se il tiro salvezza fallisce, o la metà dei danni se riesce.

legendary.name: Fist Attack
entries: Il brachydios sferra un attacco di pugno.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Il brachydios si muove alla sua velocità senza provocare attacchi di opportunità.

legendary.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Il brachidio effettua un attacco di corno o utilizza una reazione chimica.
Theorized to have grown isolated in a special environment, Raging Brachydios is a rare special {@creature Brachydios|MHMM} individual that has abnormal activation of its Slime Mold.

Raging Brachydios is a predator capable of taking on and even killing other large predatory monsters, just like Brachydios. In line with their chosen habitat and absurd strength, Raging Brachydios will encounter far more dangerous foes than regular Brachydios, but will fight them and potentially win nonetheless.

Raging Brachydios have many of the same adaptions as Brachydios, however, there is a few differences between them. Raging Brachydios are extremely large compared to normal Brachydios, but are only slightly slower than them. This size difference stems from their advanced age. The main adaption that puts them apart from normal Brachydios is the large amount of slime mold found on their body.

This Ancient slime mold is not only more active then regular slime mold, but also explodes far more violently. This provides Raging Brachydios far more potent explosions that those of its peers. This forces Raging Brachydios to develop its own special Indestructible Ebonshell, to withstand its own explosions, lest it kill itself. This in turn provides it nigh-impenetrable protection from the natural weaponry of nearly all other living creatures.

items.name: Indestructible Ebonshell
entries: {@i Handicraft+3.} Per 24 ore, si acquisisce competenza con tre strumenti artigianali a scelta ogni alba.

items.name: Flashpoint Slime
entries: {@i (Requires a shield)} While you are attuned to this armor, you can use an action to prime your shield. The next time you take damage from a melee attack, fire erupts from the shield and bathes the attacker in flames. The attacker must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this property twice, regaining all expended uses on a short or long rest.

items.name: Brachydios Lash
entries: {@i Adrenaline.} La prima volta che si scende sotto la metà dei propri punti ferita in combattimento, si ottiene una scarica di adrenalina. Al prossimo turno la velocità di movimento raddoppia e si può compiere un'azione extra.

items.name: Brach Obliterator
entries: {@i (Lance & Greatsword only)} Your Guard AC bonus now lasts until the start of your next turn and you cannot be knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: Immortal Reactor
entries: {@i Biology.} Si diventa abili con le {@item dung bomb|AGMH}s mentre si indossa questa armatura e si è immuni agli effetti di blight come {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} o l'incantesimo {@spell blight}.

items.name: Brach Warhead
entries: Si è immuni ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Brachydios Pallium
entries: {@i Iron Wall+.} Si ha un bonus di +3 alla classe Armatura quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Indestructible Ebonshell
entries: {@i Speed Sharpening.} Si può spendere 1 minuto per affilare un'arma da taglio. Quando si colpisce una creatura per la prima volta dopo averla affilata, l'arma infligge al bersaglio il massimo dei danni da taglio o perforazione.

items.name: Flashpoint Slime
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery+2.} While attuned to this weapon, your wyvernfire can now be used three times per long rest and you can add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage of your shell attacks.

items.name: Brachydios Lash
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit+.} Quando si ha vantaggio su un tiro di attacco con quest'arma e si colpisce il bersaglio, si può far infliggere alla propria arma il massimo dei danni se il più basso dei due tiri di d20 colpirebbe anche il bersaglio (tutti i dadi di danno extra devono essere comunque tirati). Si può usare questa proprietà per un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Forza o Destrezza (a scelta), recuperando tutti gli utilizzi al termine di un riposo breve o lungo.

items.name: Brach Obliterator
entries: {@i Bombardier+.} The weapon has 12 runes, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following Spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell aganazzar's scorcher|XGE} (2 runes), {@spell heat metal} (2 runes), {@spell scorching ray} (2 runes), {@spell melf's minute meteors|XGE} (3 runes), {@spell wall of fire} (4 runes), {@spell delayed blast fireball} (7 runes). The weapon regains 1d8 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: Immortal Reactor
entries: {@i Brawn.} While you are attuned to this weapon, it you gain the following effects:

items: Once per turn when a creature must succeed on a saving throw or become {@condition stunned} by the effect of one of your weapon attacks, they make the save with disadvantage.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, it must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. A creature cannot gain more than 2 levels of exhaustion from this weapon's property.

items.name: Brach Warhead
entries: {@i Blast Coat+.} This material provides one of the following weapon properties depending on which weapon it is placed in:

items: (Heavy Bowgun) Your {@item cluster ammo (1)|AGMH|cluster ammo} deals an extra 3d6 fire damage.
(Bow) Your {@item blast coating|AGMH} deals an extra 2d6 fire damage.

items.name: Brachydios Pallium
entries: {@i Spirit+.} When fighting a Huge or larger creature, this weapon deals 1d8 extra weapon damage and its crit range is increased by 2.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the rajang moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Fist Attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: Il salto in lungo del rajang raggiunge i 9 metri e il salto in alto i 10 metri, con o senza partenza di corsa.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Il rajang esegue due attacchi di pugno.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Kick
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Meteor {@recharge 6}
entries: The rajang jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to roll into a ball and come crashing down in a space, within 40 feet of it, that contains one or more creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the rajang's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the rajang's space.

action.name: Lighting Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The rajang exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Il rajang si muove fino alla sua velocità senza provocare attacchi di opportunità.

legendary.name: Kick
entries: Il rajang effettua un attacco di calcio.

legendary.name: Quake (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The rajang reaches for the sky and slams its body onto the ground causing the ground to shake violently. Each creature within 30 feet of the rajang must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. Any creature that fails this save by 5 or more is also {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

Il Rajang è una creatura ultra-aggressiva che viene avvistata raramente e a cui raramente si sopravvive. Ampiamente considerato come l'apice di un'impareggiabile prestanza fisica, il Rajang si dice sia un solitario e questa vita isolata ha reso difficile individuare le sue inclinazioni territoriali.

Il Rajang assomiglia molto al {@creature Blangonga|MHMM} nell'aspetto e nei movimenti, prendendo in prestito anche alcuni dei suoi attacchi. Tuttavia, le differenze più evidenti sono la muscolatura più ampia, le grandi corna, la punta della coda pelosa e la capacità di utilizzare attacchi basati sull'elettricità. L'attacco più importante del Rajang è la capacità di sparare elettricità dalla bocca, sia sotto forma di esplosione che di raggio. Sono odiati da molti avventurieri a causa della loro combinazione di velocità, aggressività e potenza.

I Rajang sono descritti come ultra aggressivi. Sono disposti ad attaccare e uccidere qualsiasi cosa li minacci, anche in modo brutale. Nel Nuovo Mondo si dimostra disposto a sfidare mostri a volte due o tre volte più grandi di lui, riuscendo persino a sopraffare o a pareggiare contro tali mostri nelle Guerre dei campi.

items.name: Rajang Fang
entries: You have advantage on {@skill Insight} checks while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rajang Blackfur
entries: Non si subisce alcun danno a temperature fino a -20 gradi Fahrenheit mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Rajang Tail
entries: {@i Imperial Wrath.} You have advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks when interacting with nobles while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rajang Claw
entries: Quando si deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza o essere colpiti {@condition prone}, lo si fa con vantaggio.

items.name: Rajang Horn
entries: You have resistance to thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Gold Rajang Pelt
entries: You have immunity to thunder damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rajang Fang
entries: {@i (Insect Glaive only)} As an action you can hurl this weapon and speak this weapon's command word, it transforms into a bolt of lightning, forming a line 5 feet wide that extends out from you to a target within 120 feet. Each creature in the line excluding you and the target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning bolt turns back into a javelin when it reaches the target. Make a ranged weapon attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes damage from the javelin plus {@damage 4d6} lightning damage. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rajang Blackfur
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} lightning damage.

items.name: Rajang Tail
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} This weapon has 7 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast the {@spell lightning bolt} spell (save {@dc 15}) from it. For 1 rune, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional rune you expend.
Quest'arma recupera 1d6 + 1 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Se si consuma l'ultima runa dell'arma, tirare un d20. Con un 1, le rune non si ricaricano per una settimana.

items.name: Rajang Claw
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 1.

items.name: Rajang Horn
entries: Your weapon gains the following properties. When one of these properties is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Lightning
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the weapon, you can cause the target to take an extra {@damage 2d6} lightning damage.

items.name: Thunder
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the weapon, you can cause the weapon to emit a crack of thunder, audible out to 300 feet. The target you hit must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Lightning Strike
entries: You can use an action to cause a bolt of lightning to leap from the weapon's tip in a line that is 5 feet wide and 120 feet long. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 9d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Thunderclap
entries: You can use an action to cause the weapon to issue a deafening thunderclap, audible out to 600 feet. Each creature within 60 feet of you (not including you) must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't deafened.

items.name: Thunder and Lightning
entries: You can use an action to use the Lightning Strike and Thunderclap properties at the same time. Doing so doesn't expend the daily use of those properties, only the use of this one.

items.name: Gold Rajang Pelt
entries: La tua arma infligge un extra {@damage 1d8} di danni da fulmine.

trait.name: Silk Gown (After the gown is destroyed; {@recharge 6})
entries: As a bonus action the rakna covers its body in a silk webbing. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 19; hp 64; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage). When a creature makes a melee weapon attack that fails to hit the rakna or silk gown by 5 or less its weapon becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful {@dc 18} Strength check to pull free. If the attack is with a natural weapon, the creature is also {@condition grappled}. Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}.

trait.name: Damage Transfer (Requires silk gown)
entries: While the rakna's body is covered by its silk gown, it takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the silk gown takes the other half.

trait.name: Rachnoids. (Requires silk gown)
entries: While its body is covered by its silk gown, the rakna always has five {@creature rachnoid|MHMM}s on its abdomen. When the silk gown is destroyed, the rachnoids fall off the rakna and use their reactions to flee by burrowing underground.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The rakna can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The rakna's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the rakna knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The rakna ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakna uses its command rachnoid (if able). It then makes three attacks; two with its claws, and one with its abdomen.

action.name: Abdomen
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage or 18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage when covered by its silk gown.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Command Rachnoids (Requires silk gown)
entries: The rakna uses one of the following actions:

items.name: Move
entries: The rakna launches three rachnoids up to 30 feet away and pulls itself to that location.

items.name: Fire Breath
entries: The rakna launches all five rachnoids off its abdomen, each landing at least 5 feet apart from each other and in a space within 20 feet of the rakna. Each rachnoid then uses its fire breath before being pulled back onto the rakna's abdomen.

items.name: Defend
entries: The rachnoids on the rakna's body attempt to shove a creature off the rakna. Roll a contested Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check using the rachnoids strength modifier. The rachnoid gains a +4 bonus to its check.

items.name: Web
entries: Up to three rachnoids use their web action.

action.name: Recharge Attack {@recharge 5}
entries: The rakna uses one of the following actions.

items.name: Fire Breath.
items.entry: The rakna spins in a circle and releases a gout of flame in a 30-foot radius around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the rakna is on the ceiling of the area, the gout of flames is released in a 30-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point up to 30 feet directly below the rakna.

items.name: Web Spray.
items.entry: The rakna exhales webbing in a 60-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 30; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

legendary.name: Command
entries: The rakna uses its command rachnoids action.

legendary.name: Flamethrower
entries: The rakna moves up to half its speed in a straight line while releasing a gout of flame in a 15-foot line that is 10 feet wide in front of it. During this movement it can pass through a Medium or smaller creature's space. Each creature in fire's path must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Web Landmine (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The rakna slams its abdomen on the ground sending three blobs of webbing into unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. When a creature that starts or enters a webbed area for the first time on a turn they are {@condition restrained} by the webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a {@dc 18} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can be attacked and destroyed (AC 18; hp 100; vulnerability to slashing damage; immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

Rakna-Kadaki are Temnocerans bristling with sharp curving spikes. Their body is covered in a purple carapace with several large spikes on the legs and the abdomen, which are used to hang their web. Unlike {@creature Nerscylla|MHMM}, Rakna-Kadaki have six legs, the first two pairs are walking legs and the last pair is held above the ground carrying the abdomen, and a pair of purplish-red, blunt pedipalps that can extend to over three times their length. The most peculiar trait of Rakna-Kadaki however is its "neck". Similar to pelican spiders, it has a long, extendable neck that can be "retracted" back on top of the thorax. Its head sports eight yellow eyes, as well as two pairs of chelicerae on its jaw.

Unlike most spiders, as well as Nerscylla, Rakna-Kadaki are capable of spitting silk from their mouth, and can spit several strands at the same time. They use this silk to bind their prey in web before finishing them off. They also capable spewing a stream of burning gas from its mouth, as well as expelling the same gas from the body.

Rakna-Kadaki are normally seen wearing their silk on the body, creating the appearance of a white gown. They also carry their {@creature rachnoid|MHMM|babies} around at all times, and can send them out to for coordinated attacks, such as spitting out globs of silk or pulling in their mother using their own silk.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Carapace
entries: {@i Constitution.} La durata degli effetti di rallentamento, come l'incantesimo {@spell slow} o l'attacco del soffio di un drago di rame, sono ridotti della metà quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Silk
entries: While you are grappling a target you can use an action to speak this armor's command word, causing rachnoid silk covering your armor to wrap around the {@condition grappled} target. Until you or the creature takes fire damage, or until it breaks free of your grapple, it has disadvantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, regaining all expended use when you finish a long rest.

items.name: R.Queen Substance
entries: While you wear this armor small spiders emerge from it, like hatching from an egg sac. The spiders are friendly to you and crawl around your armor, but provide no other noticeable benefit.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Glowgut
entries: This armor has 3 runes. It regains 1d3 runes daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one or more runes to cast the {@spell web} spell (spell save {@dc 16}). For 1 rune, you cast the spell as normal. You can increase the size of the cubed area by 5 feet for each additional rune you expend.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Sharpclaw
entries: {@i Spider Climb.} While you wear this armor, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free. You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. However, the armor doesn't allow you to move this way on a slippery surface, such as one covered by ice or oil.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Spike
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da fuoco e necrotici quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: {@i Capture Novice.} While attuned to this weapon {@item tranq bomb|AGMH}s and {@item tranq ammo (1)|AGMH|tranq ammo} roll an extra 2d8 when they hit a creature.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Carapace
entries: While attuned to this weapon you can use a bonus action to fire a strand of webbing at a creature, object, or terrain within 30 feet of you and pull yourself to the closest adjacent space to the target. If the target is a creature, they can make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature avoids the webbing and you are unable to pull yourself to it. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Glowgut
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+2.} While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Sharpclaw
entries: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Spike
entries: {@i (Bowgun only) Spread up+.} When you hit a creature with spread ammo and they are within half your normal bowgun range, increase the damage die size by 1. Additionally instead of splitting the damage, the target takes full damage from the spread ammo and each adjacent creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to your ammo save DC. On a failed save, the target is dealt the same damage as the target. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage as the target.

items.name: Drone Substance
entries: This oily like substance can be applied to the skin of a medium or smaller creature. Applying the substance takes 1 minute. The affected creature then has advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks for 1 hour. During this time if they attempt to charm a creature with spells or spell-like abilities, the targeted creature has disadvantage on its saving throw.
{@i Cursed.} When applied to a creature, there is a 10% chance to attract nearby {@creature seltas|MHMM} while in urban areas. While in the wilds, there is a 50% chance to attract nearby seltas.

items.name: Rakna-Kadaki Silk
entries: Can be used to craft {@item pitfall trap+|AGMH} (AGtMH p.63) by combining it with a {@item trap tool|AGMH} using {@item smith's tools|PHB} ({@dc 17}).

items.name: R.Queen Substance
entries: A potent pheromone sometimes released by the rakna-kadaki. It is highly valued by nobles (sell value 1,500 gp).

items.name: Monster Broth
entries: Legendary material that can be used for weapons or armor.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rathalos makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its talons. While flying, it use its wings in place of its bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fireball {@recharge 5}
entries: The rathalos exhales a fireball radius within 100 feet of its location. Each creature in a 10-foot radius Sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 45 ({@damage 13d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Rathalos are large, bipedal wyverns with a spiny, armored hide covering their body. Their outer shell features much brighter and more vibrant colors than that of their female counterpart, the Rathian. It is primarily bright red, with black markings throughout. Like the {@creature Rathian|MHMM}, Rathalos possess a flame sac which is used to produce deadly flaming projectiles from the mouth. The talons upon their feet are highly poisonous and are known to to inflict toxic mortal wounds on larger prey. In addition, their long, thick tail features a heavy spiked club at the end. Rathalos' wing membranes feature ornate patterns which are likely used to attract potential mates.

Rathalos are expert flyers, and as such are prone to hunting from the skies. By launching a surprise aerial attack, they can inflict poisonous wounds with their talons or burn prey with flaming projectiles. On the ground, Rathalos remain formidable opponents. Using their powerful legs, they can chase down prey from a distance. At a close enough range, they are known to use their sharp teeth to bite at foes as well. Some Rathalos are capable of staying in the air and launching a fireball before landing back to the ground.

Rathalos are highly territorial monsters, and as such, are aggressive towards intruders. They will chase away or attempt to kill any monster which may pose a threat to their land. While hunting, Rathalos will stalk prey from the air before swooping in for the kill. Once they have successfully brought down their prey, they will carry it away to eat in private, safe from scavengers or other large monsters which might attempt to steal the kill.

Rathalos have been spotted in many kinds of environments, from the temperate forest and hills to the extreme heat of a volcano. As a master of flight, they will travel far and wide, searching for prey from the skies.

items.name: Rathalos Scale
entries: {@i Detect+.} You gain a +2 bonus to your passive Perception while you wear this armor.

items.name: R.Inferno Sac
entries: While you are attuned to this armor, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale fire at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Una volta utilizzata, questa proprietà non può essere usata di nuovo finché non si termina un riposo lungo.

items.name: Rathalos Carapace
entries: You have a +1 bonus to your AC while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rathalos Webbing
entries: Quando si deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza o essere colpiti {@condition prone}, lo si fa con vantaggio.

items.name: Rathalos Marrow
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura, non si subiscono danni da temperature fino a 120 gradi Fahrenheit.

items.name: Rathalos Wing
entries: While you are attuned to this armor you can cast the {@spell fly} spell. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rathalos Plate
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Rathalos Ruby
entries: Si gode dell'immunità ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: R. Inferno Sac
entries: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Rathalos Marrow
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this weapon's command word, causing flames to erupt from the weapon. These flames shed bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet.

items.name: Rathalos Tail
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. They may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

items.name: Rathalos Plate
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 1.

items.name: Rathalos Ruby
entries: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Rathalos Tail
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armature o armi molto raro.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rathian makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it use its talons in place of its bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fireball {@recharge 5}
entries: The rathian exhales a fireball radius within 100 feet of its location. Each creature in a 10-foot radius Sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Rathian is a true flying wyvern similar in looks to her male counterpart, {@creature Rathalos|MHMM}. Her hide is a dull, muted green in contrast to the Rathalos's deep red, and her lower mandible features a long, protruding chin spike. Her upper back and wingtips are covered in a moss-like fur not seen on the Rathalos, and while her clubbed tail lacks bony spikes, it makes up for this with its ability to poison foes upon contact.

Rathian, like her mate, can generate flaming projectiles from her mouth. She can use the poisonous barbs on her tail club to inflict blunt-force, toxic wounds on foes, even if her tail was cut off. Her powerful legs allow her to run at high speeds, making her easily capable of chasing down most prey. Like the Rathalos, her vision is very keen, so {@item Flash Bomb|AGMH}s are useful in combat.

Rathian are high-ranking predators in the food chain. She is the female land-dwelling counterpart to the male rathalos who patrols the skies. Both will work together to capture prey and ensure the safety of their nest from predators. rathian often target smaller monsters such as {@creature kelbi|MHMM}, {@creature velociprey|MHMM} and {@creature velocidrome|MHMM} that she can easily carry back to her nest, while the stronger rathalos captures more larger herbivores and lesser wyverns instead. Rathian sits in a position directly below her male counterpart and is more likely to be challenged by monsters such as {@creature anjanath|MHMM}, {@creature jyuratodus|MHMM} and {@creature plesioth|MHMM}.

Yet the female fire wyvern is also ready to engage in precarious fights, especially when it concerns the safety of her nest. Her wrath can only be truly overwhelmed by apex predators such as {@creature tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature nargacuga|MHMM}, {@creature zinogre|MHMM} and the aggresive {@creature diablos|MHMM}. In particular, {@creature glavenus|MHMM} are serious competitors of rathian, and gruelling scars found on rathian can often be attributed to an attack from glavenus. Invasive monsters and elder dragons can also prove serious threats to rathian and her nest.

Rathians can survive in almost any territory, but prefers areas with average temperature for nesting. As a result, she is known to be encountered in a large variety of areas such as jungles, sandy plains, and forests.

Rathian is very territorial, choosing to patrol from ground while her Rathalos mate patrols from the sky. She will become very aggressive to potential threats, especially when in close proximity to her nest and young.

items.name: Rathian Scale
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to poison damage until the end of your next turn. You can use this property twice, regaining all uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: Mentre si è sintonizzati con questa armatura, si può usare un'azione bonus per pronunciare la sua parola di comando ed esalare fuoco contro un bersaglio entro 15 piedi da noi. Il bersaglio deve effettuare un tiro salvezza di Destrezza {@dc 15}, subendo {@damage 3d6} danni da fuoco se il tiro fallisce o la metà dei danni se riesce.
Una volta utilizzata, questa proprietà non può essere usata di nuovo finché non si termina un riposo lungo.

items.name: Rathian Carapace
entries: You have advantage on checks when attempting to identify poisons while attuned to this armor.

items.name: Rathian Webbing
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition poisoned} condition while you wear this armor.

items.name: Rathian Spike
entries: When you cast a spell that deals acid or poison damage, you gain a +1 bonus to its spell attack roll.

items.name: Rathian Tail
entries: While you wear this armor, you gain 2 additional hit points whenever you regain hit points by magical or non-magical means, except when spending hit dice.

items.name: Rathian Wingtalon
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+1.} While wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell haste} spell from it once per day, but can target only yourself when you do so and you gain 2 levels of {@condition exhaustion} when the spell ends.

items.name: Rathian Plate
entries: Si è immuni alla condizione {@condition poisoned} mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Rathian Ruby
entries: Si ha resistenza ai danni da veleno quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Rathian Scale
entries: If you coat this weapon with poison, the poison's save DC is increased by 2.

items.name: Flame Sac
entries: Quando si lancia un incantesimo che infligge danni da fuoco, questo infligge 1d4 danni da fuoco extra.

items.name: Rathian Spike
entries: While holding this weapon, you can use an action to cause thick, black poison to coat it. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. This weapon can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rathian Tail
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d4 poison damage.

items.name: Rath Wingtalon
entries: When you attune to this weapon, a ring manifests on one of your fingers. While you wear it, you can use an action to fire a slender wooden dart from the ring at a target within 20 feet of you. Make a ranged weapon attack; you have proficiency in the ring. On a hit, the target takes 1 point of piercing damage, and must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution save or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. It can repeat the save every 4 hours; if it succeeds three times, the effect ends, but if it fails three times, it dies. Once used, you cannot use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: Rathian Plate
entries: When you cast a spell that deals poison damage, you increase its spell save DC by 1.

items.name: Rathian Ruby
entries: Quando si impugna quest'arma, si ottiene un bonus di +1 ai tiri di attacco con incantesimo e si ignora mezza copertura quando si effettua un attacco con incantesimo.

items.name: Rathian Tail
entries: Rare armor or weapon upgrade material.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The remobra makes two tail attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Poison Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

Remobra are classified as Flying Wyverns in the Old World but, have recently been reclassed as Snake Wyverns. The Remobra have evolved wings, which are fairly large in comparison to their body size in the Old World. Despite their wings being large, their legs are relatively weak and they can barely stand up with their legs. To avoid standing up, they spend of their time in the air flying. It preys upon weakened animals, by using their poison to finish off their victim and letting it bleed to death.

items.name: Remobra Hide
entries: Riduci i danni necrotici subiti di 2 mentre indossi questa armatura.

items.name: Striped Skin
entries: {@i Luck.} Roll a d20 at the end of a successful hunt. On a 18-20, you get one additional material from the creature.

items.name: Remobra Head
entries: {@i ill Omen.} Your Charisma score increases by 1 while you wear this armor, but you have disadvantage on {@skill Persuasion} and {@skill Deception} checks due to an overwhelming feeling of disaster to those around you.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the rhenoplos moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The rhenoplos has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) danni da percosse.

Rhenoplos is a quadrupedal, Ceratopsian-like monster with an armored body. Its face features a small nose horn and is surrounded by a frill. While the eyes of Rhenoplos are not particularly proficient, their hearing is. Rhenoplos charge blindly at whatever sound startles them, including large monsters. However, this makes them easy to dodge and easy prey for predators placing them near the bottom of the food chain with most other herbivores. These creatures live in small groups, spending most of their days traversing the hot environments while foraging for shrubs and other plant matter.

items.name: Rhenoplos Shell
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura, si riducono di 3 i danni da fuoco subiti.

items.name: Rhenoplos Scalp
entries: {@i (Gunlance only) Artillery Novice.} While attuned to this weapon, you can add your Strength modifier to the damage of your shell attacks.

items.name: Raw Meat
entries: Fornisce una razione di 2 giorni se cucinato.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura non comune.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Il ludroth può respirare aria e acqua.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The royal ludroth makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, or become {@condition poisoned} with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, end the poison on a successful save.

action.name: Mucus Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: The royal ludroth spits a glob of mucus at point within 60 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot radius of that point must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage and be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't afflicted with waterblight on a successful save. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on a successful save.

It has a crown-like crest composed of several finger-like appendages tipped with black spikes as well as a large, spongey yellow mane. The Royal Ludroth has a long, serpentine body with four squat limbs. Its hind pair of legs are shaped like paddles for swimming, and its foremost pair are more muscular, tipped with developed digits ending in long black claws. Its jaws are lined with shear-like plates in the place of teeth.

As the alpha male, Royal Ludroth will usually roam around with a harem of {@creature ludroth|MHMM|females} in tow. It is an aggressive creature, and will lash out at anything that threatens it or its clan.

items.name: Spongy Hide
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to cold damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: R.Ludroth Scale
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain +2 AC while completely submerged in water.

items.name: Royal Aqua Sac
entries: You can hold your breath underwater for twice as long as normal.

items.name: R.Ludroth Tail
entries: {@i Divine Blessing.} When you take damage you are not immune or resistant to, roll a d4 and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: R.Ludroth Crest
entries: {@i Constitution.} La durata degli effetti di rallentamento, come l'incantesimo {@spell slow} o l'attacco del soffio di un drago di rame, sono ridotti della metà quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: R.Ludroth Claw
entries: This weapon deals maximum weapon damage to a creature that has an innate swimming speed.

items.name: Royal Aqua Sac
entries: You can cast the {@spell water breathing} spell once per long rest, while attuned to this weapon.

items.name: R.Ludroth Tail
entries: When you hit a creature with this weapon, they must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become poisoned with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} until the end of their next turn.

items.name: R.Ludroth Crest
entries: L'arma infligge 1d4 danni da freddo in più.

items.name: Dash Extract
entries: Materiale di artigianato per {@item mega dash juice|AGMH}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the nergigante fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nergigante has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spiked Regrowth
entries: The nergigante has spikes covering its body. When used, broken, or removed in any way; the spikes regrow instantly.
Additionally, the nergigante can use its spiked explosion immediately after it uses an action or legendary action as part of the same action or legendary action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nergigante can use its frightful presence. It then makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its horn, and two with its claws.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the nergigante's choice that is within 120 feet of the nergigante and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the nergigante's Frightful Presence f or the next 24 hours.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Wing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Meteor Crash {@recharge 5}
entries: The nergigante leaps into the air using its wings to hover briefly and comes crashing down in a 15-foot square area within 90 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 80 ({@damage 23d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Spiked Explosion
entries: The spikes on the nergigante explode outward in a 40-foot-sphere around it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage and begin to bleed from a vicious wound on a failed save or half as much damage and do not bleed on a successful one.

A creature that suffers from a vicious wound loses 4 ({@dice 1d8}) hit points at the start of each of its turns. Each time the creature suffers from another vicious wound, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 4 ({@dice 1d8}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Dragon Eater
entries: The nergigante feeds on the corpse of a dragon. A large or smaller dragon is consumed whole, while the nergigante can feed on a Huge or bigger dragon for up to 30 seconds. For each round the Nergigante feeds on a dragon, it heals for an amount equal to the dragons Challenge rating.

legendary.name: Hunger
entries: The nergigante uses its dragon eater, but only heals for half the amount it normally would.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
entries: The nergigante makes a wing attack.

legendary.name: Trample (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nergigante moves up to its speed, during this move it may move through other creatures without provoking attacks of opportunity. Any creatures the nergigante moves through must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 32 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Ruiner Nergigante is built similarly to {@creature Nergigante|MHMM}, albeit with darker scale and carapace. The variant's defining feature are the metallic spikes that grow in between their regular bone spikes on its forelimbs, nape, and wings. These spikes are much tougher and make deadlier weapons compared to the normal ones, increasing its spike explosion radius and causing a bleeding effect.

items.name: Eternal Regrowth Plate
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura, si recuperano 1d6 Punti Ferita ogni 10 minuti, a patto di avere almeno 1 Punto Ferita. Se si perde una parte del corpo, l'armatura fa sì che la parte mancante ricresca e torni alla piena funzionalità dopo 1d6 + 1 giorni, se si ha almeno 1 punto ferita per tutto il tempo.

items.name: Nergigante Cortex
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+3.} Mentre si indossa questa armatura, si può usare un'azione per lanciare l'incantesimo {@spell haste} da essa una volta al giorno, ma si può bersagliare solo se stessi quando lo si fa.

items.name: Nergigante Hardclaw
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 3d4} piercing damage to them. This damage bypasses resistance and immunity, and can't be reduced or avoided by any means.

items.name: Nergigante Flail
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura, qualsiasi colpo critico contro di voi diventa un colpo normale.

items.name: Immortal Shard
entries: You have resistance to nonmagical damage while you wear this armor. Additionally, you can use an action to make yourself immune to nonmagical damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Annihilating Greathorn
entries: While wearing this armor, you gain a +3 bonus to AC, you are immune to fire damage, and you can understand and speak Draconic. In addition, you can stand on and walk across molten rock as if it were solid ground.

items.name: Eternal Regrowth Plate
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

items.name: Nergigante Cortex
entries: {@i (Bow only)} As a bonus action you can grow a black spike from the palm of your hand and nock it to your bow. A creature hit by this spike suffers normal weapon damage and the spike lodges itself into the creature. A creature's speed is reduced by 10 feet for every spike impaled into it. If the target or a creature within 5 feet of it uses an action to pull out the spikes, or if some other effect removes them, the creature's movement speed returns to normal.
You are able to grow up to 10 black spikes. You are unable to grow anymore until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Nergigante Hardclaw
entries: L'arma infligge 2d6 danni da taglio in più.

items.name: Nergigante Flail
entries: When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, that target also has the {@spell dispel magic} spell cast on them at 5th level.

items.name: Immortal Shard
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 2d8 piercing damage.

items.name: Annihilating Greathorn
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, your strength score changes to 29. If your Strength is already equal to or greater than the weapon's score, the item has no effect on you.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the safi'jiiva fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The safi'jiiva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Suppressed Power
entries: The safi'jiiva is unable to use its sapphire star while it is above (225) half of its maximum hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The safi'jiiva can use its frightful presence. It then makes five attacks: three with its bite, and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 23}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the safi'jiiva can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw}. {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the safi'jiiva's choice that is within 120 feet of the safi'jiiva and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the safi'jiiva's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Siphon Energy
entries: While on the ground, the safi'jiiva siphons the energy from the earth, regaining 70 hit points.

action.name: Cone of Flames {@recharge 5}
entries: The safi'jiiva exhales a beam of blue flames that arcs across a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 71 ({@damage 13d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sapphire Star (1/day)
entries: The safi'jiiva rises into the air releasing a gout of blue flames below it until the start of its next turn. The flames cover the ground in a 45-foot radius around the safi'jiiva. Each creature that starts its turn in the flames or enters them for the first time on a turn must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

On the safi'jiiva's next turn but before it moves, it can use its action to release a bead of concentrated magical force that slowly falls to the ground. Upon impact at the end of the safi'jiiva's turn, the bead explodes and each creature in a 60-radius must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage plus 56 ({@damage 16d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The safi'jiiva makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The safi'jiiva makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Blue Flame Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The safi'jiiva exhales a burst of blue flames in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in a line must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Any creature that was {@condition grappled} by the safi'jiiva bite attack automatically fails their saving throw and is pushed 30 feet away from the safi'jiiva landing {@condition prone} on the ground.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Shard
entries: {@i Biology.} Si diventa abili con le {@item dung bomb|AGMH}s mentre si indossa questa armatura e si è immuni agli effetti di blight come {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} o l'incantesimo {@spell blight}.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Cortex
entries: {@i Evade Window+.} Questa armatura ha 5 rune e recupera 1d5 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Quando si fallisce un tiro salvezza di Destrezza mentre si indossa l'armatura, si può usare la reazione per spendere 1 runa per riuscire il tiro salvezza.

items.name: Safi'jiiva HardHorn
entries: While wearing this armor you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Lash
entries: While you wear this armor it casts bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Additionally you and friendly creatures standing within this bright light have advantage on saving throws to resist becoming {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Fellwing
entries: While you're wearing this armor, you can speak its command word as an action to gain the effect of the {@spell etherealness} spell, which lasts for 10 minutes or until you remove the armor or use an action to speak the command word again. This property of the armor can't be used again until the next dawn.

items.name: Pulsing Dragonshell
entries: You have immunity to fire damage, and resistance to cold and lightning damage while you wear this armor.

items.name: Zionium Crystal
entries: While you are wearing this armor you gain the following benefits:

items: You regain consciousness on a roll of 19 or 20 on death saving throws.
You can cast the {@spell regenerate} spell from it, but only target yourself. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Shard
entries: {@i Maximum Might.} While your hit points are full and you are not suffering from any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, you deal maximum weapon damage with your attacks.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Cortex
entries: {@i Critical Boost+.} You can roll two additional weapon damage dice when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a weapon attack.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Hardclaw
entries: Your weapon and other material effects in it ignore resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Safi'jiiva HardHorn
entries: L'arma infligge 2d6 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Lash
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Una creatura colpita da quest'arma non può utilizzare un'azione con ricarica fino all'inizio del tuo prossimo turno. La creatura può comunque tirare per ricaricare la sua abilità alla fine del suo turno.

items.name: Safi'jiiva Fellwing
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you add a d8 to your initiative at the start of every combat. Additionally this weapon has one rune. You can expend this rune at the start of combat to become first in the initiative order, no matter your roll. You regain the rune after 24 hours, but once before you regain the use of this feature, at the start of another combat, the DM can make you last in the initiative order.

items.name: Pulsing Dragonshell
entries: {@i Dragonvein Awakening.} This material cannot be placed in a trinket. When placed in a weapon it gains the following benefits:

items: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da fuoco in più.
When a creature must make a saving throw against a spell, weapon effect, or other abilities that inflicts a condition, the save DC is increased by 2.
Your weapon attacks critical hit range is increased by 1.

items.name: Zionium Crystal
entries: {@i True Dragonvein Awakening.} This material cannot be placed in a trinket. When placed in a weapon it gains the following benefits:

items: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da fuoco in più.
When a creature must make a saving throw against a spell, weapon effect, or other abilities that inflict a condition, they do so at disadvantage.
Your weapon attacks critical hit range is increased by 2.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the deviljho moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a body slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Se il deviljho fallisce un tiro salvezza, può invece scegliere di avere successo.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deviljho has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deviljho makes two attacks: one with its body slam and one with its bite.

action.name: Body Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. On a hit, the target must make a {@dc 23} Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 ft and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is wearing any nonmagical metal armor it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dragons Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The deviljho unleashes a terrible breath in a 60-foot cone. Each Creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 7d8}) fire damage and 49 ({@damage 11d8}) necrotic damage and they are afflicted with {@disease dragonblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and are not afflicted with {@disease dragonblight|MHMM} on a successful one. The afflicted target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The deviljho makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature that is {@condition prone}. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite damage, the target is swallowed, and no longer {@condition prone}. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the deviljho, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the deviljho turns.

If the deviljho takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the deviljho must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the deviljho. If the deviljho dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The deviljho moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The deviljho makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 actions)
entries: The deviljho makes one bite attack or uses its swallow.

Savage Deviljho are rare special {@creature Deviljho|MHMM} individuals that are abnormally old with an extreme hunger. They can be found practically anywhere like then normal deviljho, and easily assert themselves as super predators that rival elder dragons in any conceivable habitat they find themselves in and are challenged by little.

The Savage Deviljho has many of the same adaptations as a normal Deviljho, however, has a few minor differences. Savage Deviljho are noticeably always enraged. This due to being extremely hungry and constantly needing to feed. Their face is covered like a mask of dragon element, giving it a more sinister look and the hide and the blood of savage deviljho is black in color due to the effects of this element.

The savage deviljho is an even more brutal and rabid monster than the ordinary variety due to its unrelenting hunger. The black blood may drive the savage deviljho to such heightened aggression, even causing it to become a 'rogue' killing machine.

With its appearance in the New World, Savage Deviljho's supreme height in the food chain is finally confirmed. The infamous Variant of the World Eater has been seen directly confronting Elder Dragons like {@creature Velkhana|MHMM}, {@creature Namielle|MHMM} and {@creature Blackveil Vaal Hazak|MHMM}, resulting in violent elemental clashes that often end explosively in stalemates. Perhaps even more terrifyingly, the Savage Deviljho's physical prowess has increased to the point which it can feasibly stand against the immensely powerful Elder Dragon Variant {@creature Ruiner Nergigante|MHMM}, one which specializes in unyielding physical strength.

items.name: Savage Hide
entries: {@i Carving Celebrity+.} While you are attuned to this armor, you can carve a creature of CR 15 or lower 1 extra time.

items.name: Savage Scale
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} Mentre si è sintonizzati con questa armatura, si può utilizzare qualsiasi oggetto consumabile, come pozioni o cibo, come azione bonus, a patto che siate voi a consumarlo.

items.name: Savage Scalp
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura, si sente il gusto in tutte le direzioni e si ha un vantaggio sulle prove di Saggezza ({@skill Perception}) che si basano sul gusto.

items.name: Savage Saliva
entries: You cannot be {@condition frightened} while you wear this armor.

items.name: Savage Tail
entries: While you wear this armor, you can use an action, to speak the armor's command word and attempt to magically swallow either a creature, or object, that is Medium or smaller. An unwilling creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw to escape the armor's grasp. Once swallowed, the creature or object is transported to a room that exists on a plane of existence found only within the armor. The room is a 10 foot by 10 foot cube, and can hold a single, living creature, and up to 1,000 pounds of objects. There are two windows on one of the walls that peer out, giving vision of the outside world.

Per ogni ora che passa, una creatura può tentare di fuggire riuscendo in un tiro salvezza di Forza {@dc 15}. In caso di successo, la creatura viene rigurgitata e cade {@condition prone} in uno spazio entro 3 metri da voi. Inoltre, ogni volta che si subiscono 40 o più danni in un singolo turno, si deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza di Costituzione {@dc 16} o rigurgitare qualsiasi creatura inghiottita e tutti gli oggetti inghiottiti, che cadono proni in uno spazio entro 3 metri da noi. Pronunciando nuovamente la parola di comando dell'armatura, la creatura o un oggetto a scelta viene sputato fuori.

items.name: Savage Gem
entries: Si gode dell'immunità ai danni da freddo quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: Savage Talon
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit+.} Quando si ha vantaggio su un tiro di attacco con quest'arma e si colpisce il bersaglio, si può far infliggere alla propria arma il massimo dei danni se il più basso dei due tiri di d20 colpirebbe anche il bersaglio (tutti i dadi di danno extra devono essere comunque tirati). Si può usare questa proprietà per un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Forza o Destrezza (a scelta), recuperando tutti gli utilizzi al termine di un riposo breve o lungo.

items.name: Savage Tallfang
entries: {@i Partbreaker+3.} Si infligge 1d10 danni extra quando si colpisce criticamente con quest'arma.

items.name: Savage Scalp
entries: When you cast a necromancy spell, you gain a +3 bonus to its spell attack roll or increase its spell save DC by 2.

items.name: Savage Saliva
entries: {@i (Sorcerer & Wizard only)} L'arma ha 10 rune. Si può usare un'azione per spendere 1 o più rune per lanciare uno dei seguenti incantesimi, usando la propria DC di tiro salvezza: {@spell cause fear|XGE} (1 runa), {@spell ray of enfeeblement} (2 rune), {@spell ray of sickness} al 3° livello (3 rune), {@spell contagion} (4 rune) o {@spell harm} (6 rune). L'arma recupera 1d6 + 4 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Se si consuma l'ultima runa, non può riacquistare alcuna runa per una settimana.

items.name: Savage Tail
entries: Your weapon deals an extra 1d6 fire damage and an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

items.name: Savage Gem
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can speak its command word to exhale a beam of hellfire in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 5d6} fire damage and {@damage 5d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once used, you can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The yian garuga makes three attacks: two with its peck and one with its tail. Or it makes three fire ball attacks.

action.name: Fire Ball
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 5d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Fire Barrage {@recharge 5}
entries: The yian garuga exhales a barrage of fireballs in a 60-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Flight
entries: The yian garuga flies up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Poisoned Tail
entries: Choose a creature within 10 feet of the yian garuga. That creature must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Piercing Roar (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The yian garuga lets out an ear shattering roar. Each creature that is within 20 feet of the yian garuga must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is instead {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

In terms of appearance, scarred yian garuga is virtually identical to {@creature yian garuga|MHMM}. The main difference between the two is that one of this monster's ears is missing and Scarred Yian Garuga received a scar across its face.

The scarred yian garuga hunt almost exclusively at night, using its deadly poison or stabbing its prey to finish off its victim. It is just as aggressive as the yian garuga, but has adapted its attacks over its many battles, including the ability to unleash a barrage of small fire balls whilst its in the air. If hunting another predatory species such as a {@creature velocidrome|MHMM}, Yian Garuga will first stun the creature with its roar before launching any attacks.

Azure Rathalos, Pink Rathian, {@creature Tigrex|MHMM}, {@creature Nargacuga|MHMM}, and the rare {@creature Rajang|MHMM} are fierce competitors of the Bird Wyverns and are even capable of killing them if an opportunity were to arise. However, being one of if not the most feared member of the Bird Wyvern class these creatures are fully capable of defending themselves against potential threats.

items.name: Garuga Shard
entries: While wearing this armor, you have {@sense darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, your sight range increases by 60 feet.

items.name: Garuga Cortex
entries: {@i HG Earplugs.} Mentre si è sintonizzati con questa armatura, si può usare un'azione bonus per evocare due tappi per le orecchie di forma a scelta.
