entries: {@i Dark Finale.} Quando si è ridotti a 0 punti ferita ma non si è uccisi del tutto, si può usare la propria reazione per essere posseduti dalle energie maligne del Fatalis e si verifica quanto segue:

items: Si guarisce al massimo dei punti ferita.
I suoi occhi si illuminano di rosso e un'aura di ciuffi neri avvolge il suo corpo.
All'inizio di ogni turno, si subiscono 10 ({@damage 1d20}) danni necrotici. Questo danno aggira le resistenze e le immunità e non può essere ridotto o evitato in alcun modo.
Mentre si è posseduti, non si può essere {@condition grappled}, {@condition stunned} o {@condition restrained}.
Si ottiene un bonus di +2 alla CA e si ha vantaggio in tutti i tiri salvezza.
Non si può guarire con mezzi normali o magici.

entries: Quando si viene nuovamente ridotti a 0 punti ferita, si falliscono automaticamente 2 tiri salvezza per la morte e la possessione termina.

items.name: Fatalis B.Scale
entries: {@i (Melee Weapon only)} Quando si attacca una creatura con quest'arma e si tira un 20 al tiro per colpire, il bersaglio subisce un ulteriore {@damage 4d6} danno da acido. Poi si tira un altro d20. Se si ottiene un 20, uno degli arti del bersaglio si dissolve; l'effetto di tale perdita è determinato dal GM. Se la creatura non ha un arto da dissolvere, si dissolve invece una parte del suo corpo.

items.name: Fatalis R.Scale
entries: Mentre si impugna quest'arma, si può usare un'azione per pronunciare la parola di comando dell'arma ed evocare un {@creature fire elemental} e 1d4 {@creature magma mephit}s come se si fosse lanciato l'incantesimo {@spell conjure elemental} per ogni creatura.

items.name: Fatalis W.Scale
entries: Quest'arma ha 5 rune che riacquista ogni giorno all'alba. Quando si colpisce una creatura con quest'arma, si può spendere 1 runa per farle effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione {@dc 21}. Se il tiro salvezza viene fallito, il bersaglio viene raffreddato fino alle ossa per 1 minuto. Mentre è raffreddato, ha svantaggio su tutti i tiri per colpire e sulle prove di abilità e la sua velocità è ridotta di 3 metri. Una creatura può ripetere il tiro salvezza alla fine di ogni suo turno, terminando l'effetto in caso di successo.

items.name: Fatalis Shell
entries: {@i Rapid Reload.} Si può ricaricare come azione gratuita mentre si è sintonizzati con quest'arma. Inoltre, quando si effettua un tiro di attacco con armi a distanza e si tira un 20 per il tiro di attacco, si può effettuare un attacco aggiuntivo come azione gratuita.

items.name: Fatalis Webbing
entries: {@i Critical Eye+2.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 3.

items.name: Fatalis Fellwing
entries: Quest'arma funge da fuoco arcano per il vostro incantesimo. Mentre si impugna quest'arma, si può lanciare un incantesimo di 4° livello o inferiore che normalmente richiederebbe un'azione, come azione bonus.

items.name: Fatalis Cortex
entries: Quando si impugna quest'arma, essa crea un'aura in un raggio di 3 metri intorno a sé. Voi e tutte le creature amiche che si trovano nell'aura avete un vantaggio ai tiri salvezza contro incantesimi e altri effetti magici. Se si hanno 17 o più livelli nella classe del paladino, il raggio dell'aura aumenta a 9 metri.

items.name: Fatalis Horn
entries: {@i Blazing Majesty.} Come azione bonus, è possibile attivare la proprietà delle armi nota come Grazia sfolgorante per 1 minuto. Mentre la Grazia sfolgorante è attiva, si ottengono i seguenti benefici:

items: Si è immuni ai danni da fuoco.
Si può usare un'azione per lanciare {@spell Melf's Minute Meteors|XGE} ({@dc 19}) dall'arma a volontà, senza bisogno di componenti materiali.
Le tue armi infliggono un extra {@damage 2d6} di danni da fuoco.
È possibile utilizzare la proprietà {@item hammer|AGMH} di {@optfeature Mighty Weapon|AGMH} una sola volta con qualsiasi arma.

entries: Una volta utilizzata questa proprietà, non è possibile utilizzarla nuovamente fino all'alba successiva.

items.name: Fatalis Eye
entries: {@i Mind's Eye+.} I tuoi attacchi con quest'arma aggirano le resistenze e le immunità ai danni di qualsiasi creatura.

items.name: Dark Stone
entries: {@i (Trinket only)} Quando si inserisce un gingillo, si iniziano a sentire voci sommesse provenire da esso. Dopo aver trascorso alcune ore a fissare il ciondolo e ad ascoltare i loro sussurri, nominate una persona che conoscete ma sulla quale non avete mai usato questo potere. Poi, tirate 2d6+2.

items.name: On a 10+
items.entry: Il gingillo rivela un segreto che li riguarda.

items.name: On a 7-9
items.entry: Come 10+, ma dovete prima rivelare al gingillo un segreto sulle vostre speranze, paure, rimpianti o desideri.

items.name: On a 6-
items.entry: il gingillo custodisce un segreto della vostra mente.

entries: Ogni volta che il gingillo rivela un segreto, segnate una casella.
Quando si segna l'ultima casella, si sbloccano i misteri dei gingilli e si può usare {@i Shadow Magic}.

entries.name: SHADOW MAGIC
entries: Quando si tiene il gingillo e si invocano le ombre al suo interno, si può scegliere come azione uno dei seguenti elementi e tirare 2d6+2:

items.name: On a 10+
items.entry: La magia viene lanciata con successo.

items.name: On a 7-9
items.entry: Come un 10+, ma si subisce una delle conseguenze sotto riportate a scelta del GM, se decide di sceglierne una.

items.name: On a 6-
items.entry: Il gingillo cessa di funzionare finché non viene accarezzato da un respiro morente.

entries.name: ACTIONS
items: Ci si ammanta di ombre e silenzio per 1 minuto, come con gli incantesimi {@spell invisibility} e {@spell silence}. Ti muovi senza essere visto e inosservato finché non attiri l'attenzione su di te ed eviti il sole o la luce sacra.
Nominate una persona che conoscete o con la quale avete un legame arcano (capelli, indumenti, ecc.). Per le prossime 24 ore potrete vederla, sentirla e sussurrarle come da un'ombra vicina.

Scegliete una creatura che potete vedere entro 60 piedi da voi. Quella creatura deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza di Forza {@dc 17} o essere {@condition grappled} intrappolata dalle ombre che la circondano. Una creatura intrappolata dalle ombre può usare la sua azione per effettuare una prova di Forza contro la tua prova di Intelligenza ({@skill Athletics}). In caso di successo, si libera.

entries.name: CONSEQUENCES
items: Lo spirito oscuro del gingillo che si stava utilizzando fugge e si manifesta nel mondo. Cancellare l'opzione Magia dell'Ombra appena utilizzata finché lo spirito non viene costretto o convinto a rientrare nel ciondolo.

Gli occhi diventano neri come il marmo. Si ha {@sense truesight} fino a 120 piedi di distanza in condizioni di scarsa illuminazione e di oscurità, ma non si vedono colori e si è accecati dalla luce del sole.

La pelle diventa mortalmente pallida o nera come il carbone (a scelta) e gelida al tatto. Si ha immunità ai danni da freddo, ma si ha svantaggio su tutte le prove di interazione sociale. Inoltre, il sole brucia la pelle e si subiscono danni da fuoco {@damage 1d4} per ogni 10 minuti di permanenza alla luce del sole.

Si inizia a soffrire di sogni oscuri e inquietanti. Quando si riposa a lungo, si effettua un tiro salvezza di Saggezza {@dc 10}. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, non si ottengono i benefici del riposo lungo e si soffre di incubi che potrebbero rivelare un utile segreto.

Gli spiriti contenuti nel gingillo prendono possesso della vostra anima. Una volta al giorno, gli spiriti possono costringervi ad agire come con un incantesimo {@spell command}. Quando lo fanno, devi superare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza {@dc 15}. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, si segue il comando degli spiriti. Se si fallisce il tiro salvezza di 5 o più, si cade {@condition unconscious} e gli spiriti prendono il controllo del corpo per 1d4 ore. Al risveglio, non si ha memoria di ciò che si è fatto.

entries.name: Cursed
entries: Questo materiale è maledetto. Se ci si accorda con esso, si viene maledetti finché non si viene bersagliati da un incantesimo {@spell greater restoration} o {@spell wish}. Finché si rimane maledetti, non si vuole separarsi dal gingillo e lo si tiene sempre con sé.
Una volta spezzata la maledizione, non si è più in sintonia con il gingillo, non si subiscono più conseguenze e non ci si può più sintonizzare con il gingillo.

trait.name: Control Lightning
entries: The kirin can choose any location within 30 feet of it as the starting location of the {@spell lightning bolt} spell.

trait.name: Elder Seal Susceptibility
entries: When the kirin is hit by a weapon that has the elder seal material, its AC is reduced by 3 until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Fulgurmancer
entries: The kirin has advantage on Concentration checks to maintain concentration on a spell. Additionally, when a creature fails their saving throw against a spell that deals lightning damage on a turn, that creature is afflicted with {@condition thunderblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the kirin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The kirin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The kirin's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kirin makes three attacks. two with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The kirin makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) Check.

legendary.name: Smite
entries: The kirin makes a hoof attack or casts {@spell thunderclap|XGE}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The kirin moves up to its half speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The kirin casts a spell from its list of known spells, using a spell slot as normal.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kirin's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells  (spell save {@dc 20}), requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kirin is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. The kirin has the following spells prepared:

entries: Kirin resembles a unicorn, though a closer look reveals that it is covered in scales rather than a coat. Its majestic white mane and hair stand on end, as if charged with static. The monster often crackles with stray electricity.

Kirin have white fur used for picking up electricity. When enough electrical currents are picked up in the fur, Kirin will glow brightly and its hide will deflect most attacks. From this, the Adventurer's Guild believe that Kirin's high metabolism helps it pick up electricity as well. A Kirin's most vital feature is its long horn. This horn is used to summon lightning from the sky, even when there isn't a storm cloud in sight, to strike any foes that threaten it. However, even if this horn is destroyed, Kirin can still summon lightning bolts with little effort.

Some of the more rare, older, or just stronger individuals are known for having unusually strong electrical powers that are yet to be fully understood. Some of the larger, more stronger muscles are located in its legs, capable of delivering deadly kicks. Equipped with such powerful legs, all Kirin posses the ability to run at speeds so unexpectedly fast they appear to teleport, leaving behind a trail of blue electricity.

Kirin are a highly unpredictable species. Sometimes Kirin are calm, other times they are aggressive. In one legend, it was said that a Kirin actually destroyed a whole village with its electrical powers.

items.name: T.Kirin Hide
entries: {@i Marathon Runner+.} Quando si indossa questa armatura, la velocità di camminata aumenta di 3 metri e si ignorano i terreni difficili se non sono stati creati da un effetto magico.

items.name: T.Kirin Mane
entries: {@i Control Lightning.} Whenever you cast a cone or line spell that deals lightning damage, you can choose any location within 30 feet of you as the starting location.

items.name: T.Kirin Tail
entries: {@i Divine Blessing+2.} When you take damage you are not immune or resistant to, roll a d8 and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: T.Kirin Thunderhorn
entries: You have resistance to thunder damage and can't be {@condition paralyzed} while you wear this armor.

items.name: T.Kirin Azure Horn
entries: Si gode dell'immunità ai danni da fulmine quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: T.Kirin Hide
entries: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da fulmine in più.

items.name: T.Kirin Mane
entries: This weapon has 3 runes which are regained every day at dawn. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you may expend a rune to have the target make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a fail, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has its movement speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. The creature may repeat its saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: T.Kirin Tail
entries: {@i Critical Status (thunderblight).} When you hit a creature with a weapon or spell that deals lightning or thunder damage, and roll a 20 for the attack roll, the creature is afflicted with {@condition thunderblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: T.Kirin Thunderhorn
entries: When you cast a spell that deals lightning damage, you gain a +3 bonus to its spell attack roll or you increase the spell save DC by 3.

items.name: T.Kirin Azure Horn
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} This weapon has 7 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast the {@spell call lightning} spell (save {@dc 16}) from it. For 1 rune, you cast the 3rd-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional rune you expend.
Quest'arma recupera 1d6 + 1 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Se si consuma l'ultima runa dell'arma, tirare un d20. Con un 1, le rune non si ricaricano per una settimana.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

entries.name: T.Kirin Material Bonus
entries: When a character has three T.kirin materials socketed into their equipment they gain the {@i Tempered Kirin Favor} bonus.

{@b Kirin Favor.} You have have advantage on carve checks. Additionally when you roll on a creature's loot table, you can choose to reroll it and take the new roll. Once you use this bonus, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the tempered lunastra moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a Bite attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the tempered lunastra's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the tempered lunastra or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Goddess of the Blue Flame
entries: Fire damage dealt by the the tempered lunastra ignores fire resistance.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tempered lunastra fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tempered lunastra makes three attacks; two claw attacks and one bite or one tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Blue Flame Breath (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The tempered lunastra exhales blue flames in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the tempered lunastra jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage + 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the tempered lunastra's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the lunastra's space.

action.name: Supernova Pulse (1/day)
entries: The tempered lunastra beats its wings rising 20 feet into the air and releases a large burst of blue flames all around it. Each creature within 45 feet of the tempered lunastra must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage.

For the next 3 rounds, at the start of the tempered lunastra's turn, the blue flames pulse around her in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tempered lunastra moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tempered lunastra makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Devil's Powder (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tempered lunastra beats its wings releasing an explosive powder and creating a spark with her teeth. Each creature within 20 feet of the tempered lunastra must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage  and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Lunastra is colored blue as opposed to {@creature Teostra|MHMM} who is red. Her horns are flatter and wider, making a sort of crown structure. They are known to breathe concentrated streams of fire, as well as cloak themselves in a scalding aura. Lunastra are high in the food chain, feeding on both coal, to fuel her fire abilities, and live prey like {@creature Apceros|MHMM}. Though Lunastra are powerful, they have to compete with other species like {@creature Rajang|MHMM}, {@creature Deviljho|MHMM}, and {@creature Akantor|MHMM}.

Lunastra, as fire dragons, naturally have expert control over fire. They can use this ability when hunting to ensure quick and devastating kills. Despite her large size, she is quick on foot and can easily chase down fast moving prey. Lunastra can also generate a fire aura around their bodies from their horns, which helps prevent brazen monsters like {@creature Tigrex|MHMM} from dealing serious damage to them. These adaptions enable Lunastra to become a formidable apex predator wherever she is. Their wings are covered in a powder that can be released and, at will, set a flame burning in the air resulting in explosions. This explosive powder is actually the Lunastra's old skin.

Lunastra are brutal female elder dragons, quick to attack at the first sign of trouble, though not as much as Teostra. In the ruins of the old Towers, Lunastra are commonly found in their nest together with Teostra. This suggest that both actually stay in the nest together and guard their young. Though both haven't been seen in the nest together, both of their footprints can be found in the old nests and the active nests together.

items.name: T.Lunastra Scale
entries: {@i Tool Specialist.} Mentre indossi questa armatura, il tuo bonus di competenza è doppio per qualsiasi prova di abilità effettuata con uno strumento con cui sei esperto.

items.name: T.Lunastra Carapace
entries: While you wear this armor, any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee weapon attack takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage.

items.name: T.Lunastra Tail
entries: Si gode dell'immunità ai danni da fuoco quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: T.Lunastra Wing
entries: {@i Wide-Range+.} When you use {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}s, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}; all other creatures within a 20-foot radius of you gain its effect.

items.name: T.Lunastra Horn
entries: {@i Health Boost+.} I punti ferita massimi aumentano di 2 per ogni livello di personaggio indossato mentre si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: T.Lunastra Gem
entries: {@i Fiery Protection.} While wearing this armor you have immunity to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. Also when you would gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}, you can choose to ignore it. Once you use this property you can't use it until the next dawn.

items.name: T.Lunastra Scale
entries: {@i Guard.} You cannot be pushed or knocked backwards while you wield this weapon.

items.name: T.Lunastra Carapace
entries: {@i Critical Eye+.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 2.

items.name: T.Lunastra Tail
entries: L'arma infligge 1d8 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: T.Lunastra Wing
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack using this weapon, you can engulf the target in flames. At the start of each of the engulfed creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage and it can then make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, putting out the flames on a successful save. Alternatively, the engulfed creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to smother the flames ending the effect. Once used, this property can't be used again until you finish a short or long rest.

items.name: T.Lunastra Mane
entries: {@i Elderseal.} Una creatura colpita da quest'arma non può utilizzare un'azione con ricarica fino all'inizio del tuo prossimo turno. La creatura può comunque tirare per ricaricare la sua abilità alla fine del suo turno.

items.name: T.Lunastra Horn
entries: {@i Awaken.} Quando questo materiale viene inserito in un'arma che non infligge danni da freddo, fuoco, fulmine, necrotico o tuono, tira un dado danno aggiuntivo quando colpisce. Ad esempio, una spada corta tira 2d6 e una spada grande tira 3d6.

items.name: T.Lunastra Gem
entries: While holding this weapon your spell attack rolls and spell save DC increase by +2. If the spell deals fire damage, the bonus is increased to +3.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Le namielle possono respirare aria e acqua.

trait.name: Flooded
entries: Any space that has been flooded by one of namielle's actions is filled with three to four feet of water, and it is difficult terrain for any creature without a innate or magical swimming speed. The flooded areas remain flooded for 24 hours, until the namielle absorbs the water, or until it is turned to steam.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Se il namielle fallisce un tiro salvezza, può invece scegliere di avere successo.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: La capacità innata di incantesimo del namielle è Intelligenza. Può lanciare innatamente i seguenti incantesimi, che non richiedono componenti materiali:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The namielle makes two attacks: one attack with its bite and one with its claw, or it makes two attacks with its water globule.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, Reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Water Globule
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, or become affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a hit or miss, the 5 foot area below the target is flooded.

action.name: Tidal Wave
entries: The namielle conjures up a wave of water that crashes down on an area in front of it. The area can be up to 40 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

action.name: Maelstrom
entries: The water in a 40-foot radius around the namielle is pulled towards it and absorbed into its body, increasing its AC by 3 until the end of its next turn. Each creature in flooded terrain must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or take 24 ({@damage 7d6}) bludgeoning damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the namielle on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and is not pulled.

action.name: Electric Divebomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The namielle releases a torrent of water from its body, flooding the ground in a 35-foot radius around it. It then rises into the sky while gathering electricity and comes crashing down at its same location causing a massive eruption of water and a shockwave of steam. Each creature within 40 feet of the namielle must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the creature is within 15 feet of the namielle, it takes an extra 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Il namielle compie un solo attacco con il morso o con il globulo d'acqua.

legendary.name: Water Beam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The namielle exhales a torrent of water in an 90-foot cone, flooding the area. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage and be affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a failed save, or half as much damage and not affected with {@disease waterblight|MHMM} on a successful one. The water then spreads out 15 feet across the ground in all directions, flooding the area.

legendary.name: Electric Current (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The namielle touches the tip of its wing to a flooded space within 10 feet of it, sending an electric current coursing through it. This current travels through each connected flooded space causing an explosion of steam in each space as it travels through them. Each creature in those spaces must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Spaces affected by this ability then lose the flooded status.

Namielle è un Drago Anziano che ha aspetti di mante, pesci d'alto mare e meduse. Le sue ali massicce sono colorate di nero sopra e di azzurro sotto, con una luminescenza arcobaleno che pulsa costantemente. La testa è rossa e blu con la stessa luminescenza pulsante, ma quando viene svuotata dell'acqua e asciugata, presenta una colorazione lattiginosa che interessa sia il corpo che la parte inferiore delle ali. Presenta inoltre numerosi e lunghi baffi sulla mascella inferiore.

Come la maggior parte dei Draghi Anziani, la maggior parte dei mostri fugge dalla sua sola presenza. Si afferma come il vertice della catena alimentare. Ciò che consuma, tuttavia, è un mistero. In base alla sua struttura dentale aghiforme, si può ipotizzare che si nutra di pesci e, forse, di wyvern di piscina. Solo gli altri Draghi Anziani e il recente {@creature Savage Deviljho|MHMM}, di cui il Bruto Wyvern è in grado di eguagliare la forza, sembrano disposti a sfidarlo.

Namielle è un Drago Anziano molto particolare, il cui corpo ha le sembianze di varie creature dell'oceano. Le sue ali assomigliano a quelle di una manta, mentre le punte possono scaricare elettricità come un'anguilla elettrica. La membrana delle ali e alcune parti del viso si illuminano di una luce bioluminescente che pulsa con i colori dell'arcobaleno e ha grandi denti aghiformi come i pesci d'alto mare. Sulle ali sono presenti anche dei pettini, come una gelatina pettine, che le conferiscono ulteriore bioluminescenza. La sua caratteristica più notevole, tuttavia, è la capacità di produrre, controllare e assorbire acqua.

Tuttavia, quest'acqua non sembra essere acqua pura, ma una miscela di saliva interna e acqua mescolata insieme per creare una melma simile all'acqua che aderisce e rimane umida per lunghi periodi di tempo. Quest'acqua viene sparata dalla bocca e può essere assorbita liberamente e con un gesto delle ali o degli artigli anteriori può far scivolare avanti e indietro a volontà i cacciatori che si trovano su quest'acqua. Può anche sparare quest'acqua verso il suolo, provocando un'onda di marea. Ancora più interessante è che Namielle può produrre elettricità e usare i fulmini per far sì che le sue macchie d'acqua si elettrizzino ed esplodano violentemente in vapore.

Una particolarità di Namielle è che può volare anche sbattendo appena le ali e planare nell'aria come una manta nell'acqua. Namielle sembra anche avere la capacità di oscurare il sole con il suo corpo, provocando un'oscurità istantanea. Tuttavia, va notato che questa capacità è stata dimostrata solo al momento del ritrovamento.

items.name: T.Namielle Finehide
entries: {@i Tool Specialist.} Mentre indossi questa armatura, il tuo bonus di competenza è doppio per qualsiasi prova di abilità effettuata con uno strumento con cui sei esperto.

items.name: T.Namielle Hardclaw
entries: {@i Biology.} Si diventa abili con le {@item dung bomb|AGMH}s mentre si indossa questa armatura e si è immuni agli effetti di blight come {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} o l'incantesimo {@spell blight}.

items.name: T.Namielle Whisker
entries: {@i Constitution.} La durata degli effetti di rallentamento, come l'incantesimo {@spell slow} o l'attacco del soffio di un drago di rame, sono ridotti della metà quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: T.Namielle Fellwing
entries: {@i Stamina Surge+2.} Mentre si indossa questa armatura, si può usare un'azione per lanciare l'incantesimo {@spell haste} da essa una volta al giorno, ma si può bersagliare solo se stessi quando lo si fa e si guadagna 1 livello di {@condition exhaustion} quando l'incantesimo finisce.

items.name: T.Namielle Lash
entries: Questa armatura ha 3 rune e recupera 1d3 rune spese ogni giorno all'alba. Mentre la si indossa, si può usare un'azione e spendere 1 runa per far sì che l'armatura mostri uno schema mutevole di tinte abbaglianti fino alla fine del proprio turno successivo. Durante questo periodo, l'armatura diffonde una luce brillante in un raggio di 9 metri e una luce fioca per altri 9 metri. Le creature che possono vedervi hanno svantaggio nei tiri di attacco contro di voi. Inoltre, qualsiasi creatura che si trovi nella luce intensa e che possa vedervi quando il potere dell'armatura è attivato, deve superare un tiro salvezza di Saggezza {@dc 15} o diventare {@condition stunned} fino alla fine dell'effetto.

items.name: T.Namielle Mantle
entries: While wearing this armor you have resistance to cold damage and lightning damage.

items.name: T.Namielle Finehide
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to cast the {@spell levitate} spell on yourself at will.

items.name: T.Namielle Hardclaw
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon you can use a bonus action to cast the {@spell dancing lights} spell at will.

items.name: T.Namielle Whisker
entries: Quando si colpisce in modo critico con quest'arma, il bersaglio non può reagire fino all'inizio del suo turno successivo.

items.name: T.Namielle Fellwing
entries: When you finish a short or long rest you choose a damage type. This damage type can be either cold or lightning damage. A creature hit by this weapon takes an extra 1d8 of the chosen damage type.

items.name: T.Namielle Lash
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} This weapon has 10 runes. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its runes to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell shape water|XGE} (1 rune), {@spell create or destroy water} (1 rune), {@spell fog cloud} (1 rune), {@spell call lightning} (3 runes) or {@spell control water} (4 runes). The weapon regains 1d6 + 4 expended runes daily at dawn. If you expend the last rune it cannot regain any runes for one week.

items.name: T.Namielle Mantle
entries: You gain a + 2 bonus to your spell attack rolls and spell save DC while attuned to this weapon. This bonus increases to +3 when the spell you are casting deals cold or lightning damage.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the teostra's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the teostra or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Explosive Cloud
entries: At the start of the teostra's turn, it beats its wings and four clouds of explosive powder appear in unoccupied 5-foot cubes of air within 60 feet of the teostra. Additionally every 15 feet the teostra moves, it leaves a cloud of explosive powder in a 5-foot cube. The clouds remain until detonation, until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it, or when the teostra dies.
As a Bonus action, the teostra can move up to three of these clouds 20 feet in any direction.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the teostra fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The teostra's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The teostra makes three attacks: two with its claw and one with its bite or tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the teostra jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 33 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the teostra's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the teostra's space.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The teostra exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 11d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Supernova (1/day)
entries: The teostra beats its wings rising 20 feet into the air and releases a large burst of fire all around it. Each creature within a 40-foot-radius sphere of the teostra must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 63 ({@damage 14d8}) fire damage and are pushed back 10 feet on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and not pushed back.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The teostra moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The teostra makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Detonate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: All Explosive Clouds detonate and burst into flames. Each creature within 10-feet of a explosive cloud must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If a creature is within range of more than one explosive cloud, they take an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage for each additional cloud.

Teostra is a dragon with leonine features and a fiery coloration. It has a grand mane, large fangs, and a pair of horns that curve backward. Its wings are covered in fur. Teostra is the male counterpart to Lunastra. Being predatory Elder Dragons Teostra are powerful top predators and are easily capable of killing weaker animals such as {@creature Aptonoth|MHMM}, {@creature Conga|MHMM}, {@creature Bulldrome|MHMM}, {@creature Iodrome|MHMM}, {@creature Apceros|MHMM}, and {@creature Cephadrome|MHMM}. Armed with razor sharp claws and flesh ripping teeth these Elder Dragons make short work of prey and smaller predators.

Possessing mastery over flame, there are few creatures that can hope to last against Teostra for long. To defend itself, the Teostra also utilizes a heat shield which damages enemies that get too close. To keep its flame powers going, they consume coal in volcanic environments. It also has detachable wing scales or powder that explode when ignited from a spark made when Teostra bites. It uses these to defend itself from attackers, although they give little protection against enemies with resilience to extreme heat such as {@creature Akantor|MHMM} or {@creature Lavasioth|MHMM}.

Teostra can even use the powder for many close range attacks but more skilled Teostra have learnt to use the powder at long range. When Teostra angered, it will fly into the air and ignite the powder all at once. When the powder is all ignited, Teostra will be covered in a large burst of fire, that is sometimes referred to as the Supernova.

Some extremely rare individuals have more control over their flaming powers than {@creature teostra|MHMM|most}. They have a different appearance also including more yellow wing webbing, a more reddish mane, red claws, orange tail end and golden eyes. New flame techniques include leaving pockets of explosive powder across the area in the air as it fights and setting them all a flame at will.

Teostra are a very aggressive monster. It will show dominance to anything that it encounters. Compared to Lunastra, who give warnings to get out of its territory, Teostra will ruthlessly attack intruders until they are dead. As one of the most aggressive Elder Dragons, Teostra are highly feared. It is not advised to go out into the Desert, Volcano, Swamp, or Tower when pairing with {@creature Lunastra|MHMM}, as the prospect of fighting both Lunastra and Teostra together is often considered suicidal.

items.name: T.Fire Dragon Scale
entries: {@i Biology.} Si diventa abili con le {@item dung bomb|AGMH}s mentre si indossa questa armatura e si è immuni agli effetti di blight come {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} o l'incantesimo {@spell blight}.

items.name: T.Teostra Carapace
entries: While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell protection from energy} (fire) spell from it. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

items.name: T.Teostra Webbing
entries: While wearing this armor you have immunity to fire damage.

items.name: T.Teostra Horn
entries: {@i Wide-Range+.} When you use {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}s, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}; all other creatures within a 20-foot radius of you gain its effect.

items.name: T.Teostra Gem
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell fire shield} (warm shield) spell from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

items.name: T.Fire Dragon Scale
entries: {@i Quick Load.} Si può ricaricare come azione gratuita mentre si è sintonizzati con quest'arma.

items.name: T.Teostra Carapace
entries: {@i (Bow only) Special Ammo Boost+2.} Your coating now coats up to 30 arrows and your dragonpiercer deals an extra 3d6 piercing damage.

items.name: T.Teostra Claw
entries: Your weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d10} fire damage.

items.name: T.Teostra Webbing
entries: While attuned to this weapon, your fire spells bypass a creatures resistance and deal half damage to a creature that is immune to fire damage.

items.name: T.Teostra Tail
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack using this Weapon, you can engulf the target in flames. At the start of each of the engulfed creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage and it can then make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, putting out the flames on a successful save. Alternatively, the engulfed creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to smother the flames ending the effect.

items.name: T.Teostra Mane
entries: {@i Critical Eye+.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 2.

items.name: T.Teostra Horn
entries: {@i Reckless Abandon.} When you make your first attack on your turn with this weapon, you can choose to without care or regard for consequences. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but disadvantage on all saving throws and all attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of your next turn.

items.name: T.Teostra Gem
entries: {@i Latent Power +2.} When you are reduced to half of your maximum hit points for the first time in combat or at the start of your turn on the 10th round of combat, whichever comes first, you gain the effects of the {@spell haste} spell for 1 minute. Once used, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use this property again.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

entries.name: A Teostra's Lair
entries: Teostra's lair in high mountains or volcanoes, dwelling in caverns underground in the desert, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized teostra's lair, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a teostra as it sleeps. On rare occasions they can be seen living in more temperate areas such as a swamp or ancient forest, changing the area around it to suit its needs.

A teostra's lair is sometimes confused with a red dragon's lair due to both of them mainly preferring areas with intense heat. On many occasions a teostra will attempt to take a red dragon's lair for its own, either by killing the red dragon or causing it to flee while gravely injured, leaving its horde of treasure behind. The teostra will guard this horde, mainly because it now belongs to him, but will typically not add to its treasure, being more concerned with intruders than riches.
A teostra encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 14 (11,500 XP). A tempered teostra's challenge rating remains the same.

trait.name: Rime
entries: An area covered in rime is difficult terrain. Additionally any creature that ends its turn while touching a frost covered area takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and is {@condition grappled} by the frost (Escape 20).

trait.name: Ice Armor (2/day)
entries: The velkhana can use a bonus action to coat its body in ice, giving it +2 AC for 1 minute, or until it takes 55 points of damage from a single creature on a turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Se il velkhana fallisce un tiro salvezza, può invece scegliere di avere successo.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Il velkhana ha vantaggio nei tiri salvezza contro incantesimi e altri effetti magici.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The velkhana makes three attacks with its tail.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons
entries: La velkhana utilizza una delle seguenti armi a fiato.

items.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The velkhana exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. That area is covered in rime for 1 minute and each creature in that line must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 66 ({@damage 12d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Hoarfrost Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The velkhana exhales an icy blast of hoarfrost in a 60-foot cone. The area is covered in rime for 1 minute and each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, four 1 foot thick, 10-foot-square walls of ice form within the area and last for 10 minutes. If the wall is formed on a creature's space, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Each 10-foot section of the wall has 12 AC and 30 hit points, and is vulnerable to fire damage. If damaged to 0 hit points, it leaves a hole filled with freezing air. The first time a creature moves through the air on a turn, it makes a {@dc 22} Constitution save, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The velkhana covers the ground in a 15-foot radius in rime for 1 minute and it beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The velkhana can then fly up to half its flying speed.

legendary.name: Hail Storm (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The velkhana forms five boulder-sized chunks of ice from the water in the air that plummet to the ground at different points within 90 feet of it. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on each point that it chooses must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one ice chunk is affected only once.

{@creature Velkhana|MHMM} è un drago tradizionale con la struttura del corpo snella ed eretta dei draghi anziani come {@creature kushala daora|MHMM}. Le sue scaglie e il suo guscio sono di un blu cristallino unico. La testa ha una corona di piccole corna simili a quelle di un tiara. Richiama il ghiaccio per ricoprire le ali, gli arti e la coda. La sua coda sottile, simile a una lancia, è molto flessibile e può colpire i nemici.

Il Velkhana controlla liberamente il ghiaccio e il vento freddo e può ricoprire di ghiaccio vaste aree in un istante. Respira fasci di fluido superfreddo che possono congelare istantaneamente i mostri. Quando è ricoperto dalla sua armatura di ghiaccio, nelle vicinanze si formano cristalli di ghiaccio che, se colpiti dal soffio di ghiaccio di Velkhana, formano grandi guglie che presto esplodono. A volte si formano piccole piattaforme di ghiaccio da cui si può saltare. Occasionalmente, quando è infuriato, dalle nuvole vicine al terreno piovono picchi di ghiaccio.

items.name: T.Crystal Shard
entries: {@i Flinch Free.} Quando si indossa questa armatura non si può essere urtati {@condition prone} o spostati involontariamente dalla propria posizione attuale con qualsiasi mezzo.

items.name: T.Velkhana Cortex
entries: {@i Divine Blessing+3.} When you take damage you are not immune or resistant to, roll a d10 and reduce the damage you take by the number rolled. You can use this property a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: T.Velkhana Lash
entries: Quando si indossa questa armatura si è resistenti ai danni da freddo e immuni alla malattia {@condition iceblight|MHMM}.

items.name: T.Velkhana Hardclaw
entries: Quando una creatura che vi tocca o vi colpisce con un attacco con un'arma da mischia entro un raggio di 2 metri da voi, potete usare la vostra reazione per farle effettuare un tiro salvezza di Costituzione {@dc 16}. Se il tiro salvezza fallisce, la creatura è afflitta da {@condition iceblight|MHMM} per 1 minuto. Una creatura può ripetere il tiro salvezza alla fine del proprio turno, terminando l'effetto in caso di successo. Si può usare questa proprietà un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Costituzione 1 + (minimo 1), recuperando tutti gli usi spesi al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crownhorn
entries: {@i (Sorcerer, Warlock, & Wizard only)} This armor has two runes that it regains daily at dawn. As an action you can expend one of these runes to cast {@spell armor of agathys} at 5th level from it.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crystal
entries: Si è immuni ai danni da freddo quando si indossa questa armatura.

items.name: T.Crystal Shard
entries: {@i Quick Sheath.} Mentre si è sintonizzati con quest'arma, si può sempre sguainarla come azione gratuita anche se si è già estratta un'arma come parte della propria azione di movimento.

items.name: T.Velkhana Cortex
entries: While attuned to this weapon you can use an action to cast the wall of ice (save {@dc 17}) spell from it, but it deals only {@damage 5d6} cold damage and the wall is only 5 feet high. Once you use this property, new walls deal no damage and are only 3 feet tall until you finish along rest.

items.name: T.Velkhana Lash
entries: While you are attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word and exhale ice in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Si può usare questa proprietà due volte, recuperando tutti gli usi spesi al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: T.Velkhana Hardclaw
entries: Your cold spells bypass a creature's resistance to cold damage while you are attuned to this weapon.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crownhorn
entries: {@i Critical Draw++.} Durante il primo round di combattimento, gli attacchi con armi da mischia ottengono un colpo critico con un tiro di 13 o superiore.

items.name: T.Velkhana Crystal
entries: {@i Coalescence+.} Whenever you succeed on a saving throw to end a condition, you gain a +2 bonus to your attack rolls and spell save DC, and your weapon or spell attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d6} cold, fire, or lightning damage (your choice) until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

entries.name: T.Velkhana Divinity
entries: {@b Set bonus (2):} When you critically hit with a weapon or spell that deals cold damage, you deal an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage.
{@b Set bonus (4):} An aura of frost builds when your weapon is sheathed for at least 1 minute. When you draw this weapon, it deals an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage for the next 4 rounds.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the teostra's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the teostra or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Explosive Cloud
entries: At the start of the teostra's turn, it beats its wings and four clouds of explosive powder appear in unoccupied 5-foot cubes of air within 60 feet of the teostra. Additionally every 15 feet the Teostra moves, it leaves a cloud of explosive powder in a 5-foot cube. The clouds disperse after detonation, until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it, or when the teostra dies.
As a Bonus action, the teostra can move up to two of these clouds 10 feet in any direction.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The teostra's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The teostra makes three attacks; two claw attacks one bite or tail attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} per colpire, portata 10 m, un bersaglio. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On hit, the target must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the teostra jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 33 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 feet out of the teostra's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is with in range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the teostra's space.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The teostra exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 9d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Supernova
entries: The teostra beats its wings rising 20 feet into the air and releases a large burst of fire all around it. Each creature within 25 foot radius of the teostra must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage and are pushed back 10 feet on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one and not pushed back.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The teostra moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The teostra makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Detonate (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: All Explosive Clouds detonate and burst into flames. Each creature within 10-feet of a explosive cloud must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. If a creature is within range of more than one explosive cloud, they take an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage for each additional cloud.

Teostra is a dragon with leonine features and a fiery coloration. It has a grand mane, large fangs, and a pair of horns that curve backward. Its wings are covered in fur. Teostra is the male counterpart to {@creature Lunastra|MHMM}. Being predatory Elder Dragons Teostra are powerful top predators and are easily capable of killing weaker animals such as {@creature Aptonoth|MHMM}, {@creature Conga|MHMM}, {@creature Bulldrome|MHMM}, {@creature Iodrome|MHMM}, {@creature Apceros|MHMM}, and {@creature Cephadrome|MHMM}. Armed with razor sharp claws and flesh ripping teeth these Elder Dragons make short work of prey and smaller predators.

Possessing mastery over flame, there are few creatures that can hope to last against Teostra for long. To defend itself, the Teostra also utilizes a heat shield which damages enemies that get too close. To keep its flame powers going, they consume coal in volcanic environments. It also has detachable wing scales or powder that explode when ignited from a spark made when Teostra bites. It uses these to defend itself from attackers, although they give little protection against enemies with resilience to extreme heat such as {@creature Akantor|MHMM} or {@creature Lavasioth|MHMM}.

Teostra can even use the powder for many close range attacks but more skilled Teostra have learnt to use the powder at long range. When Teostra angered, it will fly into the air and ignite the powder all at once. When the powder is all ignited, Teostra will be covered in a large burst of fire, that is sometimes referred to as the Supernova.

{@creature tempered teostra|MHMM|Some extremely rare individuals} have more control over their flaming powers than most. They have a different appearance also including more yellow wing webbing, a more reddish mane, red claws, orange tail end and golden eyes. New flame techniques include leaving pockets of explosive powder across the area in the air as it fights and setting them all a flame at will.

Teostra are a very aggressive monster. It will show dominance to anything that it encounters. Compared to Lunastra, who give warnings to get out of its territory, Teostra will ruthlessly attack intruders until they are dead. As one of the most aggressive Elder Dragons, Teostra are highly feared. It is not advised to go out into the Desert, Volcano, Swamp, or Tower when pairing with {@creature Lunastra|MHMM}, as the prospect of fighting both Lunastra and Teostra together is often considered suicidal.

items.name: Fire Dragon Scale
entries: {@i Biology.} Si diventa abili con le {@item dung bomb|AGMH}s mentre si indossa questa armatura e si è immuni agli effetti di blight come {@condition waterblight|MHMM}, {@condition iceblight|MHMM} o l'incantesimo {@spell blight}.

items.name: Teostra Carapace
entries: While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell protection from energy} (fire) spell from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dawn.

items.name: Teostra Webbing
entries: While wearing this armor you have resistance to fire damage.

items.name: Teostra Horn
entries: {@i Wide-Range.} Quando si usa {@table plants|AGMH|Herbs}, {@item Antidote|AGMH}s, {@item Cool Drink|AGMH}s, {@item Hot Drink|AGMH}s, {@table plants|AGMH|Adamant Seeds, or Might Seeds}; tutte le altre creature entro un raggio di 3 metri da voi ottengono il suo effetto.

items.name: Teostra Gem
entries: {@i (Spellcaster only)} While wearing this armor you can use an action to cast the {@spell fire shield} (warm shield) spell from it. Once used, you can't use this property again until the next dawn.

items.name: Fire Dragon Scale
entries: {@i Quick Load.} Si può ricaricare come azione gratuita mentre si è sintonizzati con quest'arma.

items.name: Teostra Carapace
entries: {@i (Bow only) Special Ammo Boost+1.} Your coating now coats up to 25 arrows and your dragonpiercer deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage.

items.name: Teostra Claw
entries: L'arma infligge 1d6 danni da fuoco in più.

items.name: Teostra Webbing
entries: {@i Weakness Exploit.} Quando si ha vantaggio su un tiro di attacco con quest'arma e si colpisce il bersaglio, si può far infliggere alla propria arma il massimo dei danni se il più basso dei due tiri di d20 colpirebbe anche il bersaglio (tutti i dadi di danno extra devono essere comunque tirati). Si può usare questa proprietà un numero di volte pari al proprio modificatore di Forza o Destrezza (a scelta), recuperando tutti gli utilizzi al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: Teostra Tail
entries: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack using this Weapon, you can engulf the target in flames. At the start of each of the engulfed creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage and it can then make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, putting out the flames on a successful save. Alternatively, the engulfed creature, or a creature within 5 feet of it, can use an action to smother the flames ending the effect.

items.name: Teostra Mane
entries: {@i Critical Eye.} La gittata dei colpi critici dei tuoi attacchi con le armi è aumentata di 1.

items.name: Teostra Horn
entries: {@i Reckless Abandon.} When you make your first attack on your turn with this weapon, you can choose to without care or regard for consequences. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but disadvantage on all saving throws and all attack rolls against you have advantage until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Teostra Gem
entries: {@i Latent Power +1.} Quando si viene ridotti a un quarto dei propri punti ferita massimi per la prima volta in combattimento o all'inizio del proprio turno al 10° round di combattimento, a seconda di quale dei due avvenga prima, si ottengono gli effetti dell'incantesimo {@spell haste} per 1 minuto. Una volta utilizzata, è necessario terminare un riposo breve o lungo prima di poter utilizzare nuovamente questa proprietà.

items.name: Elder Dragon Blood
entries: Materiale di potenziamento per armi di qualsiasi rarità.

items.name: Elder Dragon Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura di qualsiasi rarità.

entries.name: A Teostra's Lair
entries: Teostra's lair in high mountains or volcanoes, dwelling in caverns underground in the desert, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized teostra's lair, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a teostra as it sleeps. On rare occasions they can be seen living in more temperate areas such as a swamp or ancient forest, changing the area around it to suit its needs.

A teostra's lair is sometimes confused with a red dragon's lair due to both of them mainly preferring areas with intense heat. On many occasions a teostra will attempt to take a red dragon's lair for its own, either by killing the red dragon or causing it to flee while gravely injured, leaving its horde of treasure behind. The teostra will guard this horde, mainly because it now belongs to him, but will typically not add to its treasure, being more concerned with intruders than riches.
A teostra encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 14 (11,500 XP). A tempered teostra's challenge rating remains the same.

monster.name: Tetranadon

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tetranadon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bloated
entries: When the tetranadon swallows a creature or misses its bite attack, its size increases. While bloated, the tetranadon is Huge and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the tetranadon lacks the room to become Huge, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

If the tetranadon regurgitates a creature or terrain after failing its Constitution saving throw, it is pushed back 10 feet, knocked {@condition prone}, and {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tetranadon's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, without a running start. In addition, the tetranadon does not incur attacks of opportunity while moving with a jump.

trait.name: Sumo Strike
entries: Whenever the tetranadon makes a palm strike attack, it can move 5 feet as part of the attack. If the tetranadon is not bloated, it makes the movement without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tetranadon makes two palm strike attacks. While enlarged, it makes four palm strike attacks. It can replace any one of these attacks with a water bolt attack.

action.name: Palm Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite (When not bloated only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Miss: The tetranadon swallows a chunk of terrain and becomes bloated. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tetranadon, and takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tetranadon's turns.

The tetranadon's gullet can hold one creature or chunk of terrain at a time. While the tetranadon isn't {@condition incapacitated}, it can regurgitate the creature at any time {no action required) in a space within 5 feet of it, and is no longer bloated. The creature exits {@condition prone}.

If the tetranadon takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it (or 30 damage or more from a single creature outside of it), the tetranadon must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature or chunk of terrain and is no longer bloated. If it is a creature, it falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the tetranadon. If the tetranadon dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting prone.

action.name: Stomp (Bloated only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the ground in a 10-foot-squared area adjacent to the tetranadon in the direction of the target becomes difficult terrain.

action.name: Boulder Toss (Bloated only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Water Bolt (When not bloated only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the tetranadon jumps at least 15 feet as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked prone, and is pushed 5 feet out of the tetranadon's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the tetranadon's space.

legendaryHeader: The tetranadon can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The tetranadon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Stand
entries: If the tetranadon is prone, it stands up.

legendary.name: Stunning Strike
entries: The tetranadon chooses a creature within 5 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the tetranadon's next turn.

legendary.name: Muck Blast
entries: The tetranadon exhales gravel and water in a 15-foot cone in front of it. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage and be afflicted with {@condition waterblight|MHMM} for 1 minute on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't afflicted with waterblight on a successful one. A creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the waterblight on itself on a success.

The tetranadon is an amphibian with an inflatable belly and a turtle-like shell on their back. It has algae-like fur on its head, front legs, shell, and tail. With a toothless, platypus-like beak and webbed feet. Its eyes are orange and have the horizontal pupil common to amphibians. On its head is a crest that looks very similar to the head dish of the mythological Kappa.
When its belly is not inflated, it walks on all fours; once enough debris is swallowed, however, its belly inflates to an incredible size, and it starts standing on its hindlegs.

The tetranadon are known to swallow large amounts of gravel, which causes their belly to inflate to enormous proportions. In their bloated state, tetranadon become very sluggish, yet their attacks become more powerful, capable of shattering earth with a stomp. The tetranadon's attacks in this state can be described as "sumo-like". Surprisingly, they are capable of jumping high in the air even when their belly is inflated.

The tetranadon are known to clash with {@creature arzuros|MHMM}. When in their bloated state, they have been seen trying to swallow an arzuros during this battle. However the stocky fanged beasts are too difficult for the greedy amphibians to consume.

items.name: Tetranadon Hide
entries: While you are wearing this armor, you can use your reaction or bonus action to gain resistance to cold damage until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Tetranadon Carapace
entries: Moss grows on the shoulders of your armor where a urinamako (sea cucumber) magically appears to feed on it. No matter what you do, the urinamako always reappears on your shoulder as soon as you lose sight of it. It provides no benefit, other than looking kinda cute.

items.name: Tetranadon Beak
entries: {@i Speed Eating.} Mentre si è sintonizzati con questa armatura, si può utilizzare qualsiasi oggetto consumabile, come pozioni o cibo, come azione bonus, a patto che siate voi a consumarlo.

items.name: Aqua Sac
entries: You can hold breath underwater for twice as long as normal while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tetranadon Disc
entries: {@i Evade Extender (S).} You have a +1 bonus to Dexterity saving throws while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tetranadon Hide
entries: {@i (Monk only)} While you are attuned to this armor, you may spend one minute contemplating the patterns etched on this weapon's surface and regain a number of expended ki points equal to half your proficiency modifier. Once you use this property, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Tetranadon Carapace
entries: {@i (Bowgun only)} Your normal ammo deals an extra 2 piercing damage.

items.name: Tetranadon Beak
entries: When you make an unarmed strike while attuned to this weapon, and roll a 20 for the attack roll, the target is pushed 5 feet away from you.

items.name: Aqua Sac
entries: You can cast the {@spell water breathing} spell once per long rest, while attuned to this weapon.

items.name: Tetranadon Disc
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Aim Booster.} Before you make an attack with this weapon, you can use your bonus action to grant yourself advantage on the attack roll. You can use this property a number of times equal to 1/2 your proficiency modifier, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

items.name: Shiny Nacre
entries: {@i Orb formed within the body of a Tetranadon; possibly made of soul.} When you break the orb a soul escapes allowing you to ask one question as if by the {@spell speak with dead} spell.

items.name: Med Monsterbone
entries: Materiale raro per il potenziamento dell'armatura.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The tetsucabra can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tetsucabra's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, without a running start. In addition, the tetsucabra does not incur attacks of opportunity while moving with a jump.

trait.name: Dig
entries: As a bonus action, the tetsucabra digs up a boulder (10 AC, 5hp) with its tusks granting it +3 AC. It can then use its Boulder Toss as an Action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tetsucabra makes two attack, one with its Gore and one with its Stomp.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) danni da percosse.

action.name: Boulder Toss (requires Boulder)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

Tetsucabra is a large Amphibian with a striking orange and indigo coloration. Its lower jaw harbors large tusks along with a large set of molars that are capable of crushing prey with ease. Tetsucabra also has a spiky stubby tail that swells up when angered.

The scales of a Tetsucabra is used mainly for camouflage inside caves and on them is a special oil that holds heat. Despite the look of the scales, its skin is actually flexible yet hard somewhat resembling an actual toad's skin. A Tetsucabra's skull is robust and durable enough to take a lot of damage from threats of all sorts. Though the Tetsucabra has two large tusks, these are not used for hunting. The primary function of these tusks is for defense and as means to manipulate the environment. The tusks themselves are capable weapons, but the Tetsucabra is also capable of hefting up heavy boulders. The Tetsucabra flings these boulders out of the way of its path but it can also use this as a method of attack to injure predator and prey alike. It uses these boulders as a shield against predators and hunters to prevent attacks. It also uses this to enclose small, tight areas, making it harder to maneuver. Another fact about the Tetsucabra is its ability to spit a glob of fluid at prey items. This sticky material acts as a powerful adhesive, sticking to the body and ground like glue. Even for a hunter, the adhesive quality of this material is not very strong, but it makes every movement a labor and greatly weakens the prey, leading to a reduction in stamina. When the Tetsucabra exerts itself, its tail inflates, possibly to help it balance itself as it picks up large boulders and rocks. The legs of a Tetsucabra help it perform powerful leaps, lunges, and jumps in the air to help it either ambush prey or to reach steep slopes out of its reach. A Tetsucabra's claws are powerful enough to break rock with ease and can destroy powerful armor.

Tetsucabra are highly aggressive, territorial monsters though their ecology is much like a frog. The amphibians are well-known for attacking and eating anything that moves in their line of sight and leaping from ponds in order to grab potential prey. Despite being found in ponds, they spend most of their time on land, which could suggest that they patrol their territory on land, much like {@creature Zamtrios|MHMM}. During the breeding season male Tetsucabra will create large holes to impress females so that they'll lay their eggs in them. When the female lays her eggs in the pit the male will quickly fertilize them. After fertilizing the eggs the male will then carry them in his mouth and he will not eat anything until the offspring are fully developed.

items.name: Tetsucabra Scale
entries: Mentre si indossa questa armatura, si può usare una reazione o un'azione bonus per ottenere resistenza ai danni da fuoco fino alla fine del proprio turno successivo. Una volta utilizzata questa proprietà, non è possibile utilizzarla nuovamente fino al termine di un riposo lungo.

items.name: Tetsucabra Shell
entries: Ogni volta che si deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza o essere colpiti {@condition prone}, lo si fa con un bonus di +2.

items.name: Dignified Skull
entries: {@i Well Rested.} When you finish a long rest, you gain 5 temporary hit points for 24 hours while attuned to this armor.

items.name: Tetsucabra Tusks
entries: You gain a burrowing speed of 10 feet while you wear this armor.

items.name: Tetsucabra Scale
entries: While attuned to this weapon, you can use an action to conjure an ethereal pickaxe at will. When using this pickaxe to mine, you have advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.

items.name: Tetsucabra Claw
entries: While attuned this weapon, you can cast the {@spell mold earth|XGE} cantrip at will.

items.name: Dignified Skull
entries: {@i (Ranged weapon only) Deadeye.} La portata d'attacco normale dell'arma aumenta di 6 metri.

items.name: Tetsucabra Tusks
entries: {@i (Hammer only) Punish Draw.} A creature hit for the first time by the Hammer's {@i Mighty Weapon}, has disadvantage on the saving throw.

items.name: Paddock Oil
entries: When this oil is applied to the skin, the target gains {@sense tremorsense} out to 30 feet for 1 hour.

items.name: Jumbo Bone
entries: Materiale di potenziamento dell'armatura non comune.

monster.name: Thunder Serpent Narwa

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the narwa fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The narwa has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magnetism (1/round)
entries: The first time the narwa uses an action, legendary action, or effect that deals lightning damage on a turn, she causes four chunks of terrain within 60 feet of it to rise into the air until the start of its next turn. The raised terrain fills a 10-foot squared by 5-foot deep area. If there are large objects made of metal, like ballistas or pockets of ore, those areas targeted first by this trait.

trait.name: Resonance
entries: The first time an elf, wyverian, creature who can deal psychic damage, or has psionic abilities enters a location 1 mile of the narwa, they must succeed on a {@dc 25} Intelligence or Wisdom saving throw (target's choice). A creature with psionic abilities makes their save with advantage.
